SCAT-SORNA
SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY

SINCE THE PASSAGE OF THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA), THE SMART OFFICE HAS DESIGNED A NATIONAL STRATEGY FOR COMPREHENSIVE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION. THE DRU SJODIN NATIONAL SEX OFFENDER PUBLIC WEBSITE (NSOPW), THE SORNA EXCHANGE PORTAL (THE PORTAL), THE TRIBE AND TERRITORY SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY SYSTEM (TTSORS), AND THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY TOOL (SORT) ARE INTEGRAL PARTS OF THIS STRATEGY. THE CHALLENGES OF MANAGING THE RESOURCES ARE NUMEROUS. THEY INCLUDE MANAGING ELABORATE TECHNICAL APPLICATIONS AND SYSTEMS, FOSTERING RELATIONSHIPS WITH MANY DIFFERENT JURISDICTIONS, PROVIDING TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR A VARIETY OF ISSUES, BUILDING FLEXIBLE APPLICATIONS THAT CAN INTERFACE WITH A VARIETY OF SYSTEMS, AND IDENTIFYING NEW STRATEGIES THAT IMPROVE COLLABORATION. OVER THE PAST 14 YEARS, THE INSTITUTE FOR INTERGOVERNMENTAL RESEARCH (IIR) HAS WORKED WITH SORNA JURISDICTIONS TO OVERCOME MANY OF THESE CHALLENGES AND HAS DEVELOPED A STRONG WORKING PARTNERSHIP WITH THE VARIOUS STATES, TRIBES, AND TERRITORIES THAT IT SUPPORTS THROUGH THESE PROGRAMS. SINCE THE INCEPTION OF NSOPW, THE PORTAL, TTSORS, AND SORT, IIR HAS WORKED AT THE DIRECTION OF THE SMART OFFICE TO DEVELOP, ENHANCE, MAINTAIN, AND OPERATE THESE RESOURCES. TO ENSURE THAT THESE TECHNICAL PROGRAMS ARE EFFECTIVELY MANAGED, IIR EMPLOYS A PROJECT STRATEGY THAT INCLUDES DILIGENT PLANNING, CONSTANT EFFECTIVE MONITORING, EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE, AND EFFICIENT PROBLEM RESOLUTION, ALL TIED TOGETHER WITH IIR’S UNIQUE TECHNICAL EXPERTISE. AS A RESULT OF THIS STRATEGY, NSOPW, THE PORTAL, TTSORS, AND SORT HAVE BECOME INVALUABLE AND TRUSTED RESOURCES FOR THE PUBLIC AND THE ORGANIZATIONS THAT USE THEM. FOR THESE RESOURCES TO CONTINUE TO MEET THE GOALS AND MISSION OF THE SMART OFFICE, IIR WILL FULFILL ONE ALL-ENCOMPASSING GOAL WITH NUMEROUS SUPPORTING DELIVERABLES: GOAL 1— “TO PROVIDE THE PUBLIC WITH INFORMATION ABOUT REGISTERED SEX OFFENDERS AND FACILITATE INFORMATION SHARING AMONG JURISDICTIONS.” THE ACCOMPLISHMENT OF THIS GOAL, THROUGH THE EXECUTION OF THE DELIVERABLES AND TASKS OUTLINED IN THIS APPLICATION, WILL PROVIDE THE SMART OFFICE WITH THE RESOURCES NECESSARY TO PROVIDE THE TRAINING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND TECHNICAL SYSTEMS THE SORNA JURISDICTIONS NEED TO EFFECTIVELY MANAGE THEIR REGISTERED SEX OFFENDERS AND SHARE INFORMATION WITH EACH OTHER AND THE PUBLIC.

THE JUSTICE RESEARCH AND STATISTICS ASSOCIATION (JRSA) AND THE UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS LOWELL WILL CARRY OUT A PROJECT TO SUPPORT AND ADVANCE THE SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION INITIATIVE (SVPI). ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE UPDATING AND MAINTAINING EXISTING LITERATURE REVIEW CHAPTERS AND RESEARCH BRIEFS ORIGINALLY DEVELOPED UNDER THE SEX OFFENDER MANAGEMENT ASSESSMENT AND PLANNING INITIATIVE, AND SUPPLEMENTING THEM WITH NEW LITERATURE REVIEWS AND BRIEFS ON TOPICS OF CONTEMPORARY CONCERN. IN ADDITION, JRSA WILL CONDUCT A NATIONAL INVENTORY OF SEX OFFENDER-RELATED POLICIES AND PRACTICES, SEXUAL VIOLENCE PREVENTION EFFORTS, AND THE WAYS SEX OFFENDER-RELATED PROGRAMMING AUGMENTS SORNA. FURTHER, THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS FOR THE SMART OFFICE ON IDENTIFIED GAPS AND NEEDS IN RESEARCH AND PRACTICE, AND HOW TO LEVERAGE COORDINATED STRATEGIES AND FUNDING TO ADDRESS THEM. FINALLY, TOPICAL PUBLICATIONS WILL BE PRODUCED, TARGETED AND FRAMED FOR SPECIFIC DISCIPLINES INVOLVED IN SEX OFFENDER-RELATED WORK, AS WELL AS A SERIES OF WEBINARS, PRESENTATIONS, AND TRAINING COURSES.

THE PUERTO RICO DOJ WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO STRENGTHEN AND UPDATE THE PR-CJIS INTEGRATED REGISTRY (RCI) SYSTEM WITH NEW TECHNOLOGY FOR DATA MANAGEMENT, STORAGE, AND INFORMATION EXCHANGE TO ENHANCE SORNA IMPLEMENTATION AND IMPROVE THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY AND RELATED SERVICES. SPECIFICALLY, FUNDING WILL SUPPORT PROCUREMENT CONTRACTS TO UPDATE THE PR-CJIS RCI SYSTEM, AND TRAINING AND CONFERENCE TRAVEL FOR THE CJIS DIRECTOR AND SOR ADMINISTRATOR. THESE PLANNED ACTIVITIES WILL HELP PR-CJIS TAKE A SIGNIFICANT STEP FORWARD TOWARD THE IMPLEMENTATION OF SORNA.

THE AMERICAN SAMOA CRIMINAL JUSTICE PLANNING AGENCY WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO RETAIN REGISTRY PERSONNEL WHO HANDLE TRACKING AND FINGERPRINTING OF SEX OFFENDERS IN ITS SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION PROGRAM. ADDITIONALLY, GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT FRINGE BENEFITS AND OFFICE SUPPLIES.

THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO PURCHASE TWO VEHICLES, WHICH WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE MISSISSIPPI SEXUAL OFFENDER REGISTRY UNIT. THE VEHICLES WILL BE USED TO AID IN CONDUCTING ABSCONDER INVESTIGATIONS. IN ADDITION, GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT A STATEWIDE SYMPOSIUM FOR ALL MISSISSIPPI SHERRIFF’S OFFICES AND CRIMINAL JUSTICE AGENCY PERSONNEL RESPONSIBLE FOR SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION.

THE CADDO NATION OF OKLAHOMA SORNA PROGRAM WILL WORK TO ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING PROGRAM GOALS AND INITIATIVES: 1) DEVELOP AND CONDUCT TRAINING TO INCLUDE OFFICER SAFETY FOR CRIMINAL JUSTICE PERSONNEL RESPONSIBLE FOR SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION, NOTIFICATION, MONITORING, MANAGEMENT, AND INVESTIGATIONS OF FAILURE TO REGISTER; 2) ENFORCEMENT OF SORNA 21-DAY ADVANCE NOTICE OF INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL REQUIREMENT; 3) ENHANCE THE INFRASTRUCTURE BY GETTING TAP FULLY IMPLEMENTED DURING THE GRANT PERIOD; 4) ENHANCE THE COMMUNITY EDUCATION PROGRAM ON SEX OFFENDER TOPICS INCLUDING COLLABORATION OF VICTIM SERVICE AGENCIES; 5) IMPLEMENT PROVISION TO RECORDS MANAGEMENT; 6) IMPLEMENT REVISIONS TO THE SORNA POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AS APPROVED BY THE TRIBAL COUNCIL AND AS REVIEWED BY THE SMART OFFICE; 7) ORIENT ALL TRIBAL PROGRAM PERSONNEL BY PROVIDING INFORMATION RELATIVE TO THE SORNA PROGRAM, INCLUDING ONGOING COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS WITH OTHER JURISDICTIONS; 8) CONTINUE TO ENHANCE A PUBLIC WEBSITE TO MAKE INFORMATION AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AND PROMOTE PUBLIC AWARENESS AND COMMUNITY SAFETY IN TERMS OF SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION; 9) ENHANCE CRIMINAL JUSTICE INFORMATION SHARING AT THE JURISDICTION LEVEL AS WELL AS BETWEEN JURISDICTIONS; THEREBY, ENHANCING VICTIM AND COMMUNITY SAFETY; AND 10) DEVELOP INTERAGENCY, INTER-TRIBAL, AND TRIBAL-STATE COLLABORATIVE AGREEMENT TO ENHANCE INFORMATION SHARING.

THE BUREAU OF CRIMINAL APPREHENSION (BCA) IS THE CENTRAL REPOSITORY FOR ALL PREDATORY OFFENDER RECORDS IN MINNESOTA. GRANT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THE CONTINUED ENHANCEMENT OF ITS OUTDATED ONLINE PUBLIC REGISTRY, WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR MORE CONNECTIVITY AND ADDING ADDITIONAL CATEGORIES OF REGISTRATION DATA—INCLUDING ADDRESSES AND VEHICLES—BRINGING MINNESOTA CLOSER TO COMPLIANCE WITH SORNA’S PUBLIC NOTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS.  FUNDING WILL ALSO SUPPORT PROCUREMENT CONTRACTS FOR THE SORNA PROGRAM’S PROJECT MANAGER, QUALITY ASSURANCE ANALYST AND DEVELOPER POSITIONS.

THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF LAW ENFORCEMENT WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO ENHANCE AND MAINTAIN SORNA IMPLEMENTATION BY SUPPORTING THE SALARY OF AN ATTORNEY WITH THE OFFICE OF PROSECUTION SERVICES. THE ATTORNEY WILL PERFORM LEGAL RESEARCH OF SEXUAL PREDATORS AND OFFENDERS, OBTAINING REGISTRATION AND COURT DOCUMENTATION AND DETERMINING REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS. GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO SUPPORT PARTICIPATION IN NATIONAL SORNA TRAINING AND WILL PERFORM STATEWIDE SORNA TRAINING WITHIN FLORIDA FOR CRIMINAL JUSTICE PARTNERS; EQUIPMENT; SUPPLIES; OTHER; AND INDIRECT COSTS.

NORTHERN CHEYENNE TRIBE WILL UTILIZE GRANT FUNDING TO ENHANCE, FACILITATE, AND MAINTAIN SORNA ON ITS RESERVATION BY SUPPORTING SALARIES FOR TWO SORNA OFFICERS. IN ADDITION, TRAVEL; SOFTWARE; A VEHICLE; AND SUPPLIES WILL BE SUPPORTED WITH THESE GRANT FUNDS.

THE NORTHERN ARAPAHO TRIBE IS SEEKING FUNDING TO CONTINUE THE IMPLEMENTATION PROCESS OF THE ADAM WALSH SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA) ON THE WIND RIVER INDIAN RESERVATION. THE NORTHERN ARAPAHO TRIBE IS REQUESTING FEDERAL FUNDS TO 1) CONTINUE TO EMPLOY THE PROGRAM DIRECTOR AND COMPLIANCE OFFICER TO TEND THE SORNA PROGRAM OBJECTIVES; 2) CONTINUE TO PROMOTE PUBLIC SAFETY THROUGH THE USE OF THE WRSORNA PROGRAM DIRECTOR/COMPLIANCE OFFICER (PUBLIC SAFETY OFFICER); 3) CONTINUE TO WORK WITH OTHER JURISDICTIONS THROUGH INFORMATION SHARING AS IT RELATES TO SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION, TRACKING, NOTIFICATION, COMPLIANCE, AND ACCOUNTABILITY; 4) CONTINUE TO KEEP THE EASTERN SHOSHONE TRIBE UPDATED AND KNOWLEDGEABLE OF THE PROGRAM PROGRESS; 5) CONTINUE TO ATTEND SORNA CONTAINMENT MEETINGS WITH OTHER JURISDICTIONAL PERSONNEL; AND 6) CONTINUE TO UPDATE AND KEEP CURRENT RECORDS OF ALL REGISTERED SEX OFFENDERS WITHIN THE JURISDICTION.

THE MASSACHUSETTS EXECUTIVE OFFICE OF PUBLIC SAFETY AND SECURITY IS THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH AGENCY RESPONSIBLE FOR OVERSEEING THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY BOARD (SORB) AND ITS EFFORT TO SUBSTANTIALLY COMPLY WITH AND IMPLEMENT SORNA REQUIREMENTS. GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT THE EXISTING DATABASE (VENDOR XFACT), ELECTRONIC FILE STORAGE (VENDOR UNITY PLUS), AND SUPPORT NEEDED FOR ENHANCEMENTS TO SORB’S ELECTRONIC FILE STORAGE SYSTEM. THIS WILL ALSO ALLOW SORB TO DIGITIZE THE HISTORICAL PAPER DOCUMENTS OF ACTIVE SEX OFFENDERS TO BE UPLOADED INTO UNITY PLUS, ALLOWING EASY ACCESS AND SHARING WITH LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES.

THE WEST VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF MILITARY AFFAIRS AND PUBLIC SAFETY WILL UTILIZE GRANT FUNDS TO HIRE PART-TIME/TEMPORARY EMPLOYEES TO FOCUS SOLELY ON THE DIGITIZATION OF ALL CURRENT FILES IN THE REGISTRY. THESE EMPLOYEES WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PREPPING AND SCANNING OVER 6500 FILES IN THE SYSTEM. ADDITIONALLY, GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT A HIGH RESOLUTION/HIGH VOLUME FAX, SCANNER, PRINTER THAT WILL ENABLE THE DIGITIZATION OF SEX OFFENDER FILES, AND OVERTIME FOR THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY STAFF, INFORMATION SERVICE STAFF MEMBERS, AND FIELD TROOPERS.

THE VERMONT CRIME INFORMATION CENTER (VCIC) IS THE DESIGNATED AGENCY WITHIN VERMONT THAT PROVIDES CENTRALIZED COLLECTION, COLLABORATION AND SERVICES FOR REGISTRATION DATA OF CONVICTED SEX OFFENDERS RESIDING, WORKING, OR ENGAGED IN POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION WITHIN THE STATE. TO ADDRESS CHALLENGES AROUND MULTIPLE CONTRIBUTING DATA SOURCES, THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS THE MAINTENANCE OF OFFENDER COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT OF REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS THROUGH IMPROVED SEX OFFENDER DATA. GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT A PROCUREMENT CONTRACT FOR THE SUBSCRIPTION OF OFFENDERWATCH SERVICES.

THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES AND BANDS OF THE YAKAMA NATION IS FOCUSING ON THE FOLLOWING STRATEGIES TO MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF MAINTAINING A SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY AND REQUIRING SEX OFFENDERS TO REGISTER AND MAINTAIN CURRENT REGISTRATION AT ALL TIMES: (1) ENHANCE INFRASTRUCTURE TO ASSIST IN IMPLEMENTATION OF SORNA (2) ENHANCE JURISDICTION-WIDE SORNA IMPLEMENTATION PROGRAMS AND FUNCTIONS AND (3) IMPLEMENT RECORDS MANAGEMENT AND INFORMATION SHARING TECHNOLOGIES.

THE HAWAII CRIMINAL JUSTICE DATA CENTER WILL USE THE FUNDING TO ENHANCE THE ABILITY TO COMPLY WITH SORNA REQUIREMENTS INCLUDING COMPLYING WITH SORNA'S VERIFICATION, APPEARANCE, AND ENFORCEMENT REQUIREMENTS; CONTINUING TO MAIL OUT THE QUARTERLY VERIFICATION FORMS; AND MONITORING COMPLIANCE WITH ASSISTANCE FROM THE INVESTIGATIONS DIVISION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL.

THE PENNSYLVANIA COMMISSION ON CRIME AND DELINQUENCY (PCCD) WILL USE GRANT FUNDS FOR PASS-THROUGH SUBAWARDS TO THE PENNSYLVANIA STATE POLICE (PSP) AND PENNSYLVANIA OFFICE OF VICTIM ADVOCATE (OVA) TO SUPPORT THE FOLLOWING: 1) PERSONNEL COSTS FOR LOCAL AND STATE LAW ENFORCEMENT AS IT RELATES TO INVESTIGATIONS AND THE STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS OF THE ABSCONDER POPULATION; 2) COSTS RELATED TO THE CASE REVIEW REQUIREMENTS ESTABLISHED BY PENNSYLVANIA ACT 10 OF 2018 AND ADDITIONAL CASE REVIEWS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PENDING COMMONWEALTH V. TORSILIERI CASE AND OTHER RELATED CASES, WHILE CONTINUING TO ADHERE TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF SORNA; 3) COSTS RELATED TO TRAINING REGIONALLY BASED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS ON THE REQUIREMENTS OF SORNA; AND 4) CRITICAL RESOURCES PROVIDED BY THE OVA, WHOSE MISSION HAS BEEN TO PARTNER WITH PSP TO ASSIST THEM WITH THE IMPORTANT MANDATE OF VICTIM NOTIFICATION.

THE SOUTH DAKOTA SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO: 1) ADDRESS THE CURRENT DNA LAB TESTING BOTTLENECK BY PURCHASING A GENETIC ANALYZER TO IMPROVE EFFICIENCY IN PROCESSING OFFENDER DNA SAMPLES; 2) IMPROVE TECHNOLOGY AND INFRASTRUCTURE REGARDING THE COLLECTION, ANALYSIS, UPLOAD, AND MAINTENANCE OF OFFENDER DNA SAMPLES AND PROFILES (THIS INCLUDES REQUESTS FOR 10,000 OFFENDER DNA COLLECTION KITS); 3) PURCHASING TWO STRMIX SOFTWARE LICENSES FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF OFFENDER DNA REPORTING; AND 4) CONTINUE PROVIDING A WELL-ATTENDED SEX OFFENDER CONFERENCE FOR ALL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN SOUTH DAKOTA.

THE NEVADA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY'S SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY (SOR) UNIT CONTINUES TO WORK TOWARD 100 PERCENT CASE FILE DIGITIZATION. GRANT FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT PERSONNEL OVERTIME COSTS FOR TRAINED SOR STAFF TO COMPLETE FILE AUDITS, SCAN, INDEX, AND STORE ALL SEX OFFENDER CASE FILES; OUTREACH AND TRAINING FOR LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES ON HOW TO ACCURATELY COMPLETE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND VERIFICATION FORMS; OFFICE SUPPLIES THAT SUPPORT THE PLANNED TRAINING THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF NEVADA; AND THE HIRING OF FOUR (4) TEMPORARY CONTRACT STAFF TO CONTINUE THE SCANNING AND DIGITIZATION PROJECT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS REQUEST IS TO SUSTAIN THE SANTO DOMINGO PUEBLO’S SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION PROGRAM. THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE PUEBLO’S SORNA OFFICE IS TO DEVELOP A PROGRAM THAT IS BENEFICIAL FOR SANTO DOMINGO TRIBAL MEMBERS BY CREATING TIMELY AND CONTINUAL REGISTRATION OF SEX OFFENDERS; CONTINUING TO OPERATE AND UPDATE THE TRIBE'S SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY ALONG WITH THE TRIBE’S WEBSITE, AS WELL AS CREATING NEW AND CONTINUING COMMUNITY EDUCATIONAL EFFORTS FOR AWARENESS AND PREVENTION; AND TO STREAMLINE THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION PROCESS.

THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY WILL UTILIZE GRANT FUNDS TO PROCURE A CONTRACT THAT WILL PAY FOR COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE MAINTENANCE AND SUBSCRIPTIONS OF LIVE SCAN DEVICES USED FOR SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AT LOCAL SHERIFF’S DEPARTMENTS. ADDITIONALLY, FUNDS WILL SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF A PITNEY BOWES RELAY 4200 INSERTING SYSTEM, WHICH WILL FACILITATE THE EFFICIENCY OF THE MONTHLY ADDRESS VERIFICATION LETTER DISTRIBUTION.

THE KENTUCKY JUSTICE AND PUBLIC SAFETY CABINET WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO MAKE A SUBAWARD TO KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS (DOC), WHO WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT SALARIES OF FOUR PROBATION AND PAROLE OFFICERS AND TO ADD THE SALARY OF AN ADDITIONAL OFFICER WHO MONITOR SEX OFFENDERS SUPERVISED BY THE DOC. THE GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO OBTAIN CELLEBRITE UFED TOUCH 2 TECHNOLOGY WHICH ALLOWS DOC PERSONNEL TO RETRIEVE DATA ON A SEX OFFENDER’S MOBILE DEVICE TO ENSURE THEY ARE NOT IN VIOLATION OF SUPERVISION. IN ADDITION, FUNDS WILL SUPPORT ATTENDANCE FOR THE FOUR-PROJECT STAFF AT A NATIONAL CONFERENCE OR TRAINING EVENT.

THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP SOFTWARE TO IMPROVE THE EFFICIENCY OF THE DELAWARE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY (SOR). THIS INCREASED EFFICIENCY WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION TO FEDERAL DATABASES, SPECIFICALLY THE NATIONAL CRIME INFORMATION CENTER (NCIC). THE SOFTWARE PROPOSED WILL EXPEDIENTLY ALLOW EMPLOYEES OF THE DELAWARE SOR TO REGISTER SEX OFFENDERS, WHICH WILL DECREASE THE AMOUNT OF TIME BETWEEN REGISTRATION/VERIFICATION AND NCIC ENTRIES AND OTHER REQUIRED CHECKS AND RESULT IN REAL-TIME DATA TRANSFER. THE MODIFICATION WILL ENHANCE SEX OFFENDER TRACKING AND MANAGEMENT THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF DELAWARE, AND HARDWARE WILL BE DEPLOYED AT THREE DELAWARE SOR LOCATIONS.

THE SPIRIT LAKE TRIBE WILL USE GRANT FUNDS FOR THE CONTINUED IMPLEMENTATION OF SORNA AND ENHANCE ITS CURRENT REGISTRATION/NOTIFICATION. FUNDING WILL SUPPORT TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT ENHANCEMENTS, INCREASE COMMUNITY NOTIFICATION AND EDUCATION EFFORTS, AND DEVELOP NEW STRATEGIES TO SUPPORT COMPLIANCE CHECKS. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE DIGITIZING PAPER FILES, DEVELOPING COMMUNITY EDUCATION PROGRAMS ON SEX OFFENDER TOPICS AND/OR COLLABORATION WITH INTRATRIBAL ORGANIZATIONS, AND CONTINUING TO WORK WITH TRIBAL, FEDERAL, AND STATE OFFICIALS TO COORDINATE INFORMATION SHARING OF OFFENDERS' EMPLOYMENT, EDUCATION, AND RESIDENCE.

THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO MAINTAIN SUPPORT OF SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY STAFF POSITIONS — THE PROGRAM COORDINATOR AND THE PROGRAM ANALYST — WHICH ARE ESSENTIAL TO THE OVERALL INTEGRITY OF THE REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION PROCESS. FUNDING WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE LONG-TERM PROJECT OF DIGITIZING ALL EXISTING HARD COPY SEX OFFENDER RECORDS, WHICH WILL HELP THE STATE MOVE CLOSER TO SORNA COMPLIANCE, AND ENABLE ALL AGENCIES TO OBTAIN ACCURATE, CONSISTENT INFORMATION IN AN EFFICIENT MANNER. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO PAY THE OFFENDERWATCH YEARLY SUBSCRIPTION FEE. STAFF WILL ALSO MAKE CERTAIN EACH SEX OFFENDER’S RECORD IS THOROUGHLY RESEARCHED AND ACCURATELY REFLECTED, OBTAIN AND SHARE IMPORTANT DOCUMENTATION WITHIN THE STATE OR WITH OTHER JURISDICTIONS, AND PERFORM MANDATORY MONTHLY NCIC SEX OFFENDER RECORD VALIDATIONS.

THE GOAL OF THE NEBRASKA STATE PATROL IS TO MAINTAIN THE CURRENT LEVEL OF SORNA COMPLIANCE BY ENHANCING LAW ENFORCEMENT AND OTHER CRIMINAL JUSTICE AGENCY INFORMATION SHARING WITHIN THE JURISDICTION, AS WELL AS BETWEEN JURISDICTIONS BY IMPROVING THE ACCURACY AND TIMELINESS OF TRANSMISSION OF DATA IN THE NATIONAL SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY (NSOR) FILE WITHIN THE NATIONAL CRIME INFORMATION CENTER (NCIC).

THIS PROJECT WILL FURTHER THE TRIBE’S PLAN TO DEVELOP, EDUCATE, AND IMPLEMENT ITS SORNA PROGRAM. THE PROJECT WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE FOR A SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION PROGRAM AND CONTINUED SUPPORT WITH COORDINATED INTER-AGENCY AND INTER-JURISDICTIONAL EFFORTS. THE SORNA PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO ACHIEVE ITS GOALS TO INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING MILESTONES: 1) CONTINUANCE OF THE SORNA PROGRAM AND RECOVERY OF PROGRAM PERSONNEL; 2) EXPLORATION OF JUVENILE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION ISSUES ON THE FORT APACHE INDIAN RESERVATION; AND 3) ESTABLISHMENT OF POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR SORNA COMPLIANCE OFFICERS.

THE COMMONWEALTH OF NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS (CNMI) DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY WILL UTILIZE FUNDING TO ENHANCE THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY AND ENSURE THE COMPLIANCE OF ALL REGISTERED SEX OFFENDERS. GRANT FUNDS WILL ASSIST IN MAINTAINING THE OPERATIONAL LEVEL ON THE ISLAND OF SAIPAN; CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY UNIT ON THE ISLANDS OF TINIAN AND ROTA; INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS, AS WELL AS VICTIM AND PUBLIC SAFETY; FOCUS ON CERTIFICATION AND TRAINING FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS AND THE PROGRAM MANAGER; AND ENFORCE OFFICER SAFETY, SPECIFICALLY WHILE CONDUCTING FIELD COMPLIANCE/VERIFICATION CHECKS.

THE IOWA SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY PROVIDES THE PUBLIC INFORMATION ABOUT REGISTERED SEX OFFENDERS, CONDUCTS INVESTIGATIONS CONCERNING VIOLATIONS OF THE REGISTRATION LAW, AND WORKS WITH LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT PARTNERS AND THE U.S. MARSHALS SERVICE ON A ROUTINE BASIS. GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT IMPROVEMENTS TO THE IOWA SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY BY ENHANCING THE SUPPORT AND MAINTENANCE OF TECHNICAL SYSTEMS, IMPROVING THE REGISTRATION AND CRIMINAL JUSTICE INFORMATION SHARING PROCESSES, ENHANCING EFFORTS TO LOCATE AND APPREHEND ABSCONDERS, SUPPORTING ADDRESS VERIFICATION AND  PROVIDING PUBLIC SAFETY. IN ADDITION, FUNDS WILL ASSIST IN PROVIDING ACCURATE, EFFICIENT AND TIMELY INFORMATION FROM THE REGISTRY TO THE NATIONAL CRIME INFORMATION CENTER (NCIC) AND THE NATIONAL SEX OFFENDER PUBLIC WEBSITE.

THE RED LAKE BAND OF CHIPPEWA INDIANS WILL USE GRANTS FUNDS TO CONTINUE TO IDENTIFY, REGISTER, AND MONITOR ALL CONVICTED SEX OFFENDERS WHO LIVE ON OR ENTER THE RED LAKE RESERVATION, AND WILL CARRY OUT AT LEAST 108 CONTACTS WITH SEX OFFENDERS DURING EACH YEAR OF THE PROJECT; RAISE THE INCIDENCE OF COMMUNITY REPORTING OF SEX OFFENDER PRESENCE ON THE RESERVATION BY 25 PERCENT OR MORE OVER THE CURRENT RATE; CONDUCT EDUCATION/TRAINING SESSIONS ABOUT THE REGISTRY – WHAT IT DOES AND HAS DONE, HOW TO ACCESS IT, HOW TO USE IT, AS WELL AS THE USE OF THE TRIBAL ACCESS PROGRAM. THE REGISTRY OFFICE WILL ALSO BRING DISPLAYS AND INFORMATION ABOUT THE REGISTRY TO PUBLIC EVENTS AT RED LAKE TO BUILD AWARENESS OF THE FUNCTIONALITIES AMONG THE BROADER COMMUNITY.

THE SAULT SAINTE MARIE TRIBE OF CHIPPEWA INDIANS WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE MAINTENANCE OF ITS SORNA PROGRAM, TO INCLUDE FUNDING THE CURRENT SORNA PROJECT COORDINATOR POSITION; CONDUCTING COMMUNITY EDUCATION THROUGHOUT THE TRIBE’S SERVICE AREA; AND CONDUCTING OFFENDER REGISTRATIONS AND VERIFICATIONS TO KEEP THEIR COMMUNITIES SAFE.

MICHIGAN STATE POLICE WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE ESTABLISHMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF STATE-WIDE QUALITY ASSURANCE CHECKS. THE INJUNCTION AND SIGNIFICANT LEGISLATIVE CHANGES EFFECTIVE MARCH 24, 2021, LEFT A RESIDUAL GAP IN COMMUNICATION BETWEEN LAW ENFORCEMENT AND REGISTRANTS, PRESENTING A SIGNIFICANT NEED TO ADDRESS DATA VALIDITY AND CONFIRM THE LOCATION OF REGISTRANTS. AS A RESULT, A SUBSTANTIAL NUMBER OF OUTDATED OFFENDER RECORDS WILL NEED TO BE UPDATED AS OFFENDERS ARE LOCATED AND BROUGHT BACK INTO COMPLIANCE. FUNDS WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THE DEPARTMENTAL TECHNICIAN IN PERFORMING SECOND PARTY CHECKS; TRACKING REGISTRANTS MOVING TO AND FROM MICHIGAN; AND UPLOADING MAILED-IN AND FAXED REGISTRANT DOCUMENTS. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL ENHANCE CURRENT PROCESSES AND ASSIST IN MEETING THE INCREASING DEMANDS OF THE RAPIDLY GROWING SEX OFFENDER POPULATION IN MICHIGAN.

THE WYOMING OFFICE OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL (WYAG) IS THE DESIGNATED AGENCY IN THE STATE OF WYOMING PROVIDING CENTRALIZED COLLECTION, COLLABORATION, AND SERVICE FOR SORNA DATA ON CONVICTED SEX OFFENDERS IN THE STATE. THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING ARE TO: 1) ENHANCE JURISDICTION WIDE IMPLEMENTATION OF AND MAINTAIN CONTINUED COMPLIANCE OF THE STATE OF WYOMING WITH SORNA REQUIREMENTS THROUGH TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENTS AND CONTINUED USAGE OF THE FUNCTIONS OF WSOR; 2) CONTINUED USE OF SAFE VIRTUAL NEIGHBORHOOD (SVN) APPLICATION AND CONTINUED OFFERING TO THE CITIZENS OF WYOMING AT NO COST; 3) ENHANCE BIOMETRIC SAMPLE OFFENDER COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS BY THE WYOMING STATE CRIME LABORATORY (WSCL); AND 4) ENSURE THAT ALL WYOMING STAFF (ON THE LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL LEVELS) WHO WORK ON MAINTAINING WSOR RECEIVE ADEQUATE AND UP TO DATE TRAINING/KNOWLEDGE.

VIRGINIA STATE POLICE PROPOSES TO USE AWA FUNDS TO ALLOW FOR A DIRECT INTERFACE BETWEEN VIRGINIA SEX OFFENDER MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (VSOMS) AND THE VIRGINIA DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS (VDOC), VDOC PROBATION AND PAROLE, AND LOCAL JAILS. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR MORE EFFICIENT PROCESSING OF SEX OFFENSE REGISTRANTS WHO ARE BEING RECEIVED, TRANSFERRED, AND RELEASED FROM THOSE AGENCIES' FACILITIES. THE GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT A CONTRACT WITH VSOMS VENDOR; TRAVEL; AND INDIRECT COSTS.

THE OHIO ATTORNEY GENERAL’S OFFICE WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO INCREASE THE ACCURACY OF THE STATE’S REGISTRATION SYSTEM, AS WELL AS ITS CAPABILITY TO COMMUNICATE WITH OTHER STATE AGENCIES AND LOCAL IN-STATE LAW ENFORCEMENT. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROCURE A CONTRACT WITH OFFENDERWATCH TO UPGRADE ITS CURRENT SOFTWARE WITH CUSTOMIZATIONS AND PURCHASE NEW SOFTWARE, WHICH WILL KEEP NSOR DATA ACCURATE. THESE CHANGES WILL ALLOW FOR THE INTERFACE OF OFFENDERWATCH RECORDS WITH OTHER DATA SYSTEMS, ALLOW FOR THE ELIMINATION OF INAPPLICABLE DATA, AND CORRECT INCOMPLETE SEX OFFENDER RECORDS.

ALABAMA OFFICE OF PROSECUTION OF SERVICES WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO TRAIN PROSECUTORS, LAW ENFORCEMENT, PROBATION AND PAROLE, AND OTHER CRIMINAL JUSTICE AGENCIES THAT PROSECUTE, REGISTER, MONITOR, AND TRACK SEX OFFENDERS IN ALABAMA.

THE PURPOSE OF THE WINNEBAGO TRIBE OF NEBRASKA’S PROJECT WILL BE TO CONTINUE AND ENHANCE ITS JURISDICTIONAL IMPLEMENTATION OF SORNA BY IMPROVING PUBLIC SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY SYSTEMS TO SUPPORT AND MAINTAIN SORNA IMPLEMENTATION; IMPROVE STAFF UNDERSTANDING OF SEX OFFENDER MONITORING AND REGISTRY; INCREASE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE OF SEX OFFENSES AND SEX OFFENDER WHEREABOUTS; AND MAKE SORNA RECORDS AND DATA ACCESSIBLE TO LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN AND SURROUNDING THE WINNEBAGO RESERVATION JURISDICTION.

FORT BELKNAP TRIBE WILL UTILIZE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE SALARY OF A SORNA PROGRAM MANAGER WHO WILL EXECUTE THE FUNCTION OF THE TRIBE’S SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY PROGRAM. ADDITIONALLY, THE GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT TRAVEL; VEHICLE; GENERAL OFFICE SUPPLIES; AND INDIRECT COSTS.

THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO CONTRACT WITH VARIOUS VENDORS AND ENTITIES TO HIRE DATA COLLECTION STAFF, WHO WILL ASSIST WITH THE COLLECTION OF SEX OFFENDER INFORMATION, ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES, AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF TRAININGS TO ENSURE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY CONFORMANCE AND NCIC COMPLIANCE.

THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF EMERGENCY SERVICES AND PUBLIC PROTECTION, DIVISION OF STATE POLICE, OFFENDER REGISTRY UNIT WILL USE GRANT FUNDS FOR OVERTIME TO CONDUCT FACE-TO-FACE VERIFICATIONS AS PART OF THE BACKLOG PROJECT OF OPEN SEX OFFENDER VIOLATIONS. ADDITIONALLY, GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT STAFF FRINGE BENEFITS, TRAVEL TO CONFERENCES AND WORKSHOPS, OTHER AND INDIRECT COSTS.

THE ARIZONA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY WILL UTILIZE FUNDING TO: 1) ENHANCE JURISDICTION-WIDE IMPLEMENTATION OF AND COMPLIANCE WITH SORNA THROUGH TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENT FOR THE FUNCTIONS OF THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND VERIFICATION PROGRAMS; 2) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT TRAINING FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL RESPONSIBLE FOR SEX OFFENDER ACTIVITIES AS THEY RELATE TO SORNA IMPLEMENTATION; 3) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES TO EXPAND WORK WITH VICTIMS’ SERVICE PROVIDERS AND COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND PREVENTION PROGRAMS RELATED TO SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION, NOTIFICATION, AND MANAGEMENT; 4) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES TO ENHANCE COLLABORATION ON ABSCONDER INVESTIGATIONS; AND 5) DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES TO REPORT GRANTEE DATA AS REQUIRED BY SMART OFFICE, PROVIDE QUARTERLY USER GROUP INPUT BY REVIEWING PERFORMANCE MEASURE DATA, AND PROGRESS TOWARDS IMPLEMENTATION AND OPERATION OF STATEWIDE SOLUTIONS.

THE CHEYENNE RIVER SIOUX TRIBE (CRST) WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO IMPROVE, ENHANCE, AND EXPAND THE SERVICES AND OPERATIONS OF CRST SORNA PROGRAM ON THE CHEYENNE RIVER INDIAN RESERVATION, WHICH WILL ALLOW FOR CONTINUED COMPLIANCE AND EXPANSION OF PROGRAM DELIVERY. TO ACCOMPLISH THESE GOALS CRST WILL: 1) CONTINUE AND EXPAND A COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION CAMPAIGN; (2) SECURE A SHREDDER TO DESTROY ALL SEX OFFENDER PAPER FILES/RECORDS AFTER THEY HAVE BEEN DIGITIZED FOR ARCHIVING; AND (3) SECURE DECALS FOR THE SORNA UNIT FOR RECOGNITION OF THE UNIT AND PROGRAM. IT IS THE GOAL OF CRST TO PROTECT PUBLIC SAFETY AND THE WELL-BEING OF ALL RESERVATION RESIDENTS THROUGH THE EFFECTIVE OPERATION OF THE CRST TRIBAL SORNA PROGRAM, CONTINUED ENHANCEMENT OF PROGRAM OPERATIONS, AND CONSTANT MONITORING OF SEX OFFENDERS WITHIN THE JURISDICTION.

THE KEWEENAW BAY INDIAN COMMUNITY (KBIC) WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUSTAIN AND ENHANCE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF ITS SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY PROGRAM BY: 
1) REEVALUATING KBIC'S SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY LAWS TO ENFORCE THE ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS OF SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION, AND MODIFY LOCALLY ESTABLISHED RULES AND REGULATIONS SUCH AS THE CREATION OF SAFE ZONES AND MINIMUM DISTANCE REQUIREMENTS SO THAT THESE OPTIONAL RULES ARE ABLE TO BE PRACTICALLY AND EQUITABLY ENFORCED BETWEEN NATIVE AND NON-NATIVE OFFENDERS WITH THE COOPERATION OF STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES. 
2) WORKING WITH THE L'ANSE AND BARAGA SCHOOL SYSTEMS TO ADDRESS THE CHANGING NATURE OF SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION FOR CURRENTLY REGISTERED OFFENDERS.
3) CONTINUING TO WORK WITH NEW OR RETURNING SEX OFFENDERS THROUGH A PROGRAM OF RE-ACCLIMATION TO THE COMMUNITY BY WORKING WITH THE SOCIAL SERVICES AND MEDICAL CENTER TO TREAT NON-NATIVE AS WELL AS NATIVE OFFENDERS.
4) ENHANCING COMMUNITY AWARENESS, AND TRAINING LAW ENFORCEMENT AND ALL OTHER USERS WITH ACCESS TO CRIMINAL HISTORY INFORMATION, BY KEEPING THE COMMUNITY INFORMED REGARDING THE CURRENT STATUS OF THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY AND ANY CHANGES TO REGISTRY LAWS.

THE COLORADO DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY’S OVERARCHING GOALS FOR THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE REGISTRY SUPPORT AND INFRASTRUCTURE, USE EVIDENCE TO DRIVE PROGRAM ENHANCEMENT BY EVALUATING THE IMPACT OF STATE RESOURCES, AND PLAN FOR SORNA SUSTAINABILITY.

THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF WARM SPRINGS INDIAN RESERVATION OF OREGON PLANS TO CONTINUE A HIGH-QUALITY SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES SERVICES AND TRAINING FOR THE WARM SPRINGS POLICE DEPARTMENT, TRIBAL PROSECUTION, VICTIMS OF CRIMES SERVICES, TRIBAL COURT, CHILDREN’S PROTECTIVE SERVICES, WARM SPRINGS COMMUNITY COUNSELING CENTER, AND THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE OBJECTIVE IS TO CONTACT AND CONTINUE REGISTRATION FOR THE KNOWN CONVICTED SEX OFFENDERS RESIDING IN OR WORKING WITHIN THE BOUNDARIES OF THE RESERVATION, AS WELL AS KEEPING THE OFFENDERS IN COMPLIANCE WITH SORNA REQUIREMENTS. THIS GRANT PROJECT WILL ALLOW ONE DEDICATED SEX OFFENDER ADMINISTRATOR POSITION TO CONTINUE AS A FULL-TIME POSITION TO ENSURE OVERALL SERVICES ARE BEING MET WITH COLLABORATION AND COORDINATION WITH TRIBAL, FEDERAL, AND STATE PROGRAMS.

THE NEW JERSEY STATE POLICE (NJSP) WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO ADDRESS THE ISSUES OF NONCOMPLIANCE AND ASSIST IN MAINTAINING THE MOST ACCURATE AND COMPLETE NSOR RECORDS. THE NJSP WILL PROCURE A NEW APPLICATION WITH WATCH SYSTEMS--NCIC BOOST--TO PROVIDE A METHOD THAT WILL SUPPORT THE IDENTIFICATION, CORRECTION, AND POPULATION OF ERRONEOUS/MISSING NSOR DATA. FURTHERMORE, TO ASSIST IN ALLEVIATING THE ISSUE OF FINGERPRINT COLLECTION AND SUBMISSION, THE NJSP WILL PURCHASE LIVE SCAN DEVICES TO COLLECT AND SUBMIT FINGERPRINTS. THESE PURCHASES WILL BRING AGENCIES INTO COMPLIANCE WITH REQUIRED FINGERPRINT COLLECTION OR ASSIST IN KEEPING AGENCIES IN COMPLIANCE BY REPLACING OUTDATED EQUIPMENT.

THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE (CA DOJ) WILL UTILIZE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT CALIFORNIA SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION BUSINESS AND TECHNICAL PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES BY ACQUIRING NEW COMPUTER SYSTEMS (I.E., LAPTOPS, DESKTOPS, POWER CORDS, ADAPTERS, DOCKING STATIONS, PRINTERS ETC.) AND ALL NECESSARY HARDWARE. THESE SUPPLIES WILL REPLACE THE CA DOJ’S VIOLENT CRIME INFORMATION CENTER’S (VCIC) OUTDATED COMPUTER SYSTEMS AND HARDWARE. WITH THE NEW COMPUTER SYSTEMS AND SUPPORTING HARDWARE, VCIC PERSONNEL WILL BE ABLE TO CORRECT TECHNOLOGY INCONSISTENCIES, OPTIMIZE STAFF PERFORMANCE LEVELS, AND PREVENT NEW MALWARE AND CYBER SECURITY EXPLOITS THAT CAN EASILY INFILTRATE THE SYSTEMS AND COMPROMISE THE INTEGRITY OF CALIFORNIA’S SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION INFORMATION.

THE SKOKOMISH TRIBE IS DEVELOPING A MODEL TRIBAL PROGRAM AND REQUESTS A THREE-YEAR GRANT TO CONTINUE TO MEET CHALLENGES AND IMPLEMENT STRATEGIES FOR THE SORNA PROGRAM THAT NOT ONLY BENEFITS THE SKOKOMISH PEOPLE, BUT CAN BE SHARED WITH OTHER TRIBAL COMMUNITIES.  THE ACTIVITIES HAVE BEEN WELL PLANNED AND UTILIZES THE SKILLS OF THE SORNA OFFICER, LEGAL CONSULTANT, PUBLIC SAFETY OFFICERS AND THE MEMBERS OF THE WORKING GROUP. THE ULTIMATE OUTCOME WILL BE A MODEL TRIBAL PROGRAM ENFORCING SORNA AND NETWORKING WITH LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES AND PEOPLE ON AND OFF THE FEDERAL INDIAN RESERVATIONS.

THE PROGRAM GOALS OF NOOKSACK INDIAN TRIBE ARE TO 1) HIRE A SECOND FULL TIME SORNA OFFICER; 2) PROVIDE THE HIRED OFFICER WITH SORNA SPECIFIC TRAINING; 3) PROVIDE THE SORNA OFFICER WITH TRAIN-THE-TRAINER SKILLS AND ALLOW THE OFFICER TO EDUCATE OTHER NPD STAFF AND THE COMMUNITY ON SEXUAL ASSAULT RESPONSE AND PREVENTION; 4) PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS ABOUT SEXUAL ASSAULT; 5) EQUIP THE SORNA OFFICER WITH TECHNOLOGY AND SUPPLIES TO PROVIDE SAFE AND EFFECTIVE COMMUNITY OUTREACH; AND 6) PLAN, PUBLICIZE, PROVIDE AND/OR ATTEND COMMUNITY EDUCATION EVENTS.

THE TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE (TDCJ) WILL USE THE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT SALARIES FOR TWO CASE MANAGER POSITIONS WHO WILL BE HOUSED IN THE TDCJ’S PAROLE DIVISION HEADQUARTERS IN AUSTIN, TEXAS. THE OFFICERS WILL MONITOR SEX OFFENDER COMPLIANCE TO ENSURE OVERSIGHT OF THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION PROCESS. IN ADDITION, THE GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT GENERAL OFFICE SUPPLIES (I.E., LAPTOP, CUBICLE, PRINTERS, FILE CABINETS ETC.), AND OTHER COSTS TO INCLUDE OFFICE SPACE AND DATABASE UPGRADES.

MUSCOGEE (CREEK) NATION WILL UTILIZE FUNDS TO 1) EXPAND AND ENHANCE THE MUSCOGEE CREEK NATION LIGHTHORSE POLICE SORNA PROGRAM INTO A SUSTAINABLE PROGRAM THAT WILL MEET THE NEEDS OF THE MCN RESERVATION, AND 2) EXPAND A SUSTAINABLE AND PRACTICAL PROGRAM THAT ADDRESSES THE ISSUES OF SEX OFFENDERS NOT REGISTERING UPON ENTERING TRIBAL PROPERTY AND REACH MCN CITIZENS AND OTHER AMERICAN INDIANS/ALASKAN NATIVES WITH INFORMATION AND EDUCATION ON THE SORNA PROGRAM.

THE ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY (DPS) MANAGES THE STATE’S SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY (SOR) AND WILL UTILIZE FUNDING TO REPLACE THE CURRENT MODULE THAT RESIDES ON A LEGACY MAINFRAME SYSTEM. THE DPS WILL CONTRACT WITH COMPUTER PROJECTS OF ILLINOIS (CPI) TO MODERNIZE THE LEGACY MAINFRAME CRIMINAL HISTORY REPOSITORY. THE CPI MODULE WILL ENABLE THE DPS TO IMPLEMENT SORNA REQUIREMENTS MORE FULLY FOR THE IMMEDIATE TRANSFER OF INFORMATION AND WILL ENABLE THE STATE TO COMPLY WITH THE SORNA COMMUNITY NOTIFICATION REQUIREMENT.

THE TENNESSEE BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION (TBI) WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO STRENGTHEN THE STATE'S IMPLEMENTATION OF SORNA. TBI’S GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT OVERTIME PAY FOR AN SOR ANALYST WHO WILL PROCESS TERMINATIONS, CURRENT, AWAITING, AND FUTURE REQUESTS RECEIVED DURING THE PROJECT PERIOD; A PROCUREMENT CONTRACT WITH A NEW VENDOR FOR A TEMPORARY SOR ATTORNEY; TRAVEL; GENERAL SUPPLIES; AND OTHER COST INCLUDING REGISTRATIONS AND SUBSCRIPTION FEES, ETC.

THE SUPERIOR COURT OF GUAM WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO SUPPORT ITS SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY PROGRAM BY PAYING THE SALARIES OF TWO FEDERALLY FUNDED CASE MANAGERS WHO REGISTER SEX OFFENDERS THAT LIVE, WORK AND TRAVEL TO GUAM. THE GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO SUPPORT DIGITIZING NEW INCOMING SEX OFFENDER CASE FILES; TRAVEL; GENERAL OFFICE SUPPLIES; AND OTHER COSTS.

THE COMMONWEALTH OF NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS (CNMI) DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY INTENDS TO INVEST THE 2021 GRANT FUNDS IN MAINTAINING ITS OPERATIONAL LEVEL ON SAIPAN ISLAND AND TO CONTINUE DEVELOPING THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY UNIT ON TINIAN AND ROTA ISLANDS. THE PROGRAM PROPOSES TO INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS, AS WELL AS VICTIM AND PUBLIC SAFETY; FOCUS ON CERTIFYING AND TRAINING LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS AND THE PROGRAM MANAGER; ENFORCE OFFICER SAFETY; CONTINUE TO APPLY AND IMPLEMENT PROGRAM GOALS AND OBJECTIVES; CONDUCT HOME VISITS; AND ENSURE THAT CNMI IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH SORNA IMPLEMENTATION REQUIREMENTS.

THE GILA RIVER INDIAN COMMUNITY’S POLICE DEPARTMENT (GRPD) PROPOSES TO USE FUNDS TO ENHANCE ITS ALREADY SUBSTANTIALLY IMPLEMENTED SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA) PROGRAM WITHIN THE RURAL AND ECONOMICALLY DISTRESSED COMMUNITY OF THE GILA RIVER INDIAN RESERVATION. GRPD PLANS TO IMPROVE ITS SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY SYSTEM, SUPPORT AND MAINTAIN SORNA COMPLIANCE BY MEETING PROGRAM PROJECT GOALS, PROVIDE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO GRPD SORNA STAFF IMPLEMENTING SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION PROGRAM ACTIVITIES, AND ENHANCE SORNA-RELATED NATIONWIDE INFORMATION SHARING.

THE EDWARD BYRNE MEMORIAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE GRANT (JAG) PROGRAM ALLOWS STATES TO SUPPORT A BROAD RANGE OF ACTIVITIES TO PREVENT AND CONTROL CRIME BASED ON THEIR OWN STATE AND LOCAL NEEDS AND CONDITIONS. GRANT FUNDS CAN BE USED FOR STATE AND LOCAL INITIATIVES, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAINING, PERSONNEL, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, CONTRACTUAL SUPPORT, AND INFORMATION SYSTEMS FOR CRIMINAL JUSTICE OR CIVIL PROCEEDINGS, INCLUDING FOR ANY ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING PROGRAM AREAS: 1) LAW ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS; 2) PROSECUTION AND COURT PROGRAMS; 3) PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS; 4) CORRECTIONS AND COMMUNITY CORRECTIONS PROGRAMS; 5) DRUG TREATMENT AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS; 6) PLANNING, EVALUATION, AND TECHNOLOGY IMPROVEMENT PROGRAMS; 7) CRIME VICTIM AND WITNESS PROGRAMS (OTHER THAN COMPENSATION); 8) MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS AND RELATED LAW ENFORCEMENT AND CORRECTIONS PROGRAMS, INCLUDING BEHAVIORAL PROGRAMS AND CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAMS; AND 9) IMPLEMENTATION OF STATE CRISIS INTERVENTION COURT PROCEEDINGS AND RELATED PROGRAMS OR INITIATIVES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: MENTAL HEALTH COURTS; DRUG COURTS; VETERANS COURTS; AND EXTREME RISK PROTECTION ORDER PROGRAMS.

THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS HAS THE STATUTORY OBLIGATION TO CARRY OUT THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY AND COMMUNITY NOTIFICATION. CURRENTLY, WISCONSIN HAS 26,208 REGISTERED SEX OFFENDERS WITH AN AVERAGE INCREASE OF ONE PER CALENDAR DAY.  WISCONSIN SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY CONTINUES TO WORK TOWARD IMPLEMENTATION OF THE REQUIREMENTS THE ADAM WALSH ACT (AWA), ALSO KNOWN AS SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA). WISCONSIN IS ASKING FOR FUNDING TO EXPAND THE NUMBER OF WORKSTATIONS FOR STAFF THAT MONITORS THE WHEREABOUTS OF SEX OFFENDERS ON GPS AND ISSUES WARRANTS FOR ARREST, PURCHASE LAPTOPS TO REPLACE EXISTING DESKTOP COMPUTERS AND TELEPHONE HEADSETS. IF WISCONSIN IS AWARDED FUNDING UNDER THE SMART FY 2022 SUPPORT FOR ADAM WALSH ACT IMPLEMENTATION GRANT PROGRAM FOR THESE INITIATIVES, WISCONSIN WILL HAVE INCREASED COMMUNITY SAFETY, AN ENHANCED COLLECTION AND SHARING OF SORNA DATA AND ENHANCE THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY RECORDS MANAGEMENT PRACTICES.

RHODE ISLAND PURCHASED A SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY AND PUBLIC NOTIFICATION SOFTWARE PACKAGE IN JULY 2020.  THE SOFTWARE ENABLES COMPLIANCE WITH THE LEGISLATIVE UPDATES MADE EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2020.  IN ADDITION, THE SOFTWARE PROVIDES: A UNIFIED PLATFORM TO ALL STATE AND LOCAL AGENCIES INVOLVED IN SEX OFFENDER MANAGEMENT, INCREASED EFFICIENCY AND ACCURACY IN THE REGISTRY, BUILT-IN MONITORING AND TRACKING TOOLS, AUTOMATICALLY GENERATED SORNA EXCHANGE PORTAL NOTIFICATIONS, AUTOMATIC AND IMMEDIATE UPDATES TO THE PUBLIC WEBSITE, AND GREATER OVERALL PUBLIC SAFETY.

 

THE LEGISLATIVE CHANGES, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE SOFTWARE PURCHASE, BRING RHODE ISLAND INTO SORNA COMPLIANCE IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:  IMMEDIATE TRANSFER OF INFORMATION, OFFENSES INCLUDED IN THE REGISTRY, REQUIRED REGISTRATION INFORMATION, KEEPING REGISTRATION CURRENT, PUBLIC REGISTRY WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS, COMMUNITY NOTIFICATION, WHEN AN OFFENDER FAILS TO APPEAR FOR REGISTRATION, AND WHEN AN OFFENDER HAS ABSCONDED.

 

UPON IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SOFTWARE, A DATA MIGRATION AND VERIFICATION PROJECT WAS LAUNCHED.  THE RHODE ISLAND SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY IS CURRENTLY TRANSFERRING HISTORICAL DATA FROM THE LEGACY DATABASE, ANALYZING CRIMINAL HISTORY INFORMATION, AND VERIFYING THAT ALL INFORMATION IN THE CURRENT REGISTRY DATABASE IS ACCURATE AND COMPLETE.

PUERTO RICO’S DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE THROUGH THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE INFORMATION SYSTEMS (PR-CJIS) IS WORKING CONTINUOUSLY TO IMPROVE THE SEX OFFENDER PROGRAM BY DEVELOPING, ENHANCING, AND MAINTAINING ALL THE COMPONENTS OF THE SYSTEM, IN ORDER TO IMPLEMENT SORNA SUBSTANTIALLY THROUGHOUT THE JURISDICTION. PR-CJIS, AS THE OFFICE IN CHARGE OF THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE SEX OFFENDERS REGISTRY, HAS BEEN WORKING PROACTIVELY THROUGHOUT THE PAST 12 YEARS TO FULFILL THE REQUIREMENTS AND DISPOSITIONS OF SORNA, BY DEVELOPING INNOVATIVE PROJECTS TO STRENGTHEN THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATIONS IN PUERTO RICO, TO IMPROVE THE CASE MANAGEMENT PROCESS, AND TO PROVIDE TO ALL STATE AND FEDERAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES THE ACCESS TO THE INFORMATION AND SERVICES REQUIRED TO INCREASE PROSECUTION OF THIS CASES, AND IN ULTIMATE INSTANCE PROMOTE THE NATIONAL SECURITY. 

PR-CJIS ADMINISTERS VARIOUS PUBLIC REGISTRIES, INCLUDING THE REGISTRY OF PERSONS CONVICTED OF SEXUAL OFFENSES AND CHILD ABUSE, KNOWN BETTER AS THE SEX OFFENDER’S REGISTRY. THE MAIN OBJECTIVE OF PUERTO RICO’S SEX OFFENDERS REGISTRY IS TO MAINTAIN INFORMED ALL INDIVIDUALS OR ENTITIES, UPON REQUEST, ABOUT THE WHEREABOUTS OF PERSONS WHO HAVE BEEN CONVICTED OF SEXUAL CRIMES OR ABUSE AGAINST MINORS, ESPECIALLY WHEN THE OFFENDERS REINCORPORATE TO THE FREE COMMUNITY. HOWEVER, BEYOND PROVIDING INFORMATION REGARDING THE LOCATION OF SEXUAL OFFENDERS, IT IS VITAL TO MAINTAIN THE STRUCTURE OF THE RELATED SERVICES THROUGH LEGAL ADVICE, WHICH IS REQUIRED FOR THE PROPER MANAGEMENT OF THESE CASES, BOTH FOR LAW-AND-ORDER AGENCIES AND OFFICIALS, BUT ALSO TO ENFORCE OFFENDERS’ COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE STATE AND FEDERAL REGULATIONS.

ON JUNE 30, 2022, IT WAS CREATED AS AN OFFICIAL UNIT ATTACHED TO THE DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE AND ENDORSED BY THE ATTORNEY GENERAL THROUGH AN ADMINISTRATIVE ORDER, WHICH EMPOWERS IT AS THE AUTHORIZED UNIT IN CHARGE OF THE MANAGEMENT AND ADMINISTRATION OF THE NEW SEX OFFENDERS REGISTRY AND THE PUBLIC PORTAL. SAID UNIT WILL GUARANTEE THAT THE SEX OFFENDERS REGISTRY IS RECOGNIZED AS THE MAIN INFORMATION RESOURCE AND LINK WITHIN THE COMMUNITY ABOUT PEOPLE CONVICTED OF SEXUAL CRIMES, IN ORDER TO PROTECT AND GUARANTEE THE SAFETY OF THE MOST VULNERABLE SECTORS.
 

IN ORDER TO CONTINUE REINFORCING OUR CASE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, AND SUBSTANTIALLY COMPLY WITH SORNA, PR- DOJ AND PR-CJIS, WITH SORNA 2022 REALLOCATION FUNDS INTENDS TO ENHANCE THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE SEX OFFENDERS REGISTRY UNIT (SORU) TO CONTINUE STRUCTURING, STRENGTHENING, AND OVERSEEING THE PROCESS OF APPREHENSION, REGISTRATION, AND MONITORING OF SEXUAL OFFENDERS IN THE JURISDICTION OF PUERTO RICO.

PENNSYLVANIA HAS PROPOSED A COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH TO FURTHER IMPROVE SORNA COMPLIANCE AND IMPLEMENTATION.  FY 2022 SORNA REALLOCATION FUNDS WILL SUPPORT THE PENNSYLVANIA STATE POLICE AND THE PENNSYLVANIA OFFICE OF VICTIM ADVOCATE IN EXECUTING PROJECT ACTIVITIES THAT CONTINUE TO ASSIST WITH ACHIEVING SUBSTANTIAL COMPLIANCE OF THE SORNA PORTION OF ADAM WALSH ACT.

ALTHOUGH THE OREGON STATE POLICE (OSP), SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY (SOR) SECTION HAS UTILIZED GRANT FUNDS AND OTHER RESOURCES TO IMPLEMENT SPECIFIC SORNA-RELATED ACTIVITIES AND CONTINUES TO MAKE PROGRESS TOWARDS SUBSTANTIAL IMPLEMENTATION OF SORNA REQUIREMENTS, THE STATE STILL REMAINS DEFICIENT IN CERTAIN AREAS. OSP, SOR PROPOSES TO ADDRESS SOME OF THESE AREAS WITH THIS FY 2022 SORNA REALLOCATION GRANT AWARD REQUEST.

SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION LOGISTICS AND THE VOLUME OF REGISTRATIONS ARE ALSO A CONCERN OF SOME LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES. BECAUSE OSP WANTS TO CONTINUE ASSISTING AGENCIES IN OVERCOMING BARRIERS FOR EFFICIENT ELECTRONIC SUBMISSION OF REGISTRATION DATA AND ELECTRONIC FINGERPRINT CAPTURE, OSP’S SOR SECTION IS PROPOSING 2022 SORNA REALLOCATION FUNDS BE USED TO ASSIST THESE AGENCIES ACQUIRE THE APPROPRIATE TECHNOLOGY. OSP IS ALSO PROPOSING APPROVAL OF 2022 SORNA FUNDS TO UPDATE AND REPLACE AGING COMPUTERS USED BY SOR STAFF FOR PROCESSING REGISTRATION FORMS; UPDATING REGISTRATION FORMS; TRAINING PURPOSES; AS WELL AS QUALITY ASSURANCE AND DATA ANALYSIS. REPLACEMENT OF THE EQUIPMENT WITH UPDATED DESKTOP OR LAPTOP COMPUTER EQUIPMENT WOULD HELP ENSURE SORNA-RELATED WORK IS COMPLETED WITHOUT ANY ISSUES AND IN A TIMELY MANNER.

OSP PROPOSES TO CONTINUE THE WORK BY A GRANT-FUNDED RESEARCH ANALYST 2 (RA2) POSITION TO ADDRESS CONCERNS WITH THE HIGH NUMBER OF NON-COMPLIANT SEX OFFENDERS AND CONTINUE PARTNERING WITH THE U.S. MARSHALS. THE RA2 WILL PROVIDE DOCUMENTATION USED IN MAKING THE ABSCONDER DETERMINATION AND/OR DOCUMENT ANY SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION PROVIDED BY LAW ENFORCEMENT FOR THE PURPOSES OF RECORDING UPDATES TO THE OREGON REGISTRY AND COLLECT CASE DISPOSITIONS FOR STATISTICAL PURPOSES WHEN AVAILABLE

IF AWARDED FY 2022 SORNA REALLOCATION GRANT FUNDING, IT WILL ALLOW OSP TO ASSIST IN OUR CONTINUED EFFORT TOWARD SUBSTANTIAL SORNA IMPLEMENTATION.

THE NEW HAMPSHIRE STATE POLICE, SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY (SOR) UNIT IS WORKING TOWARDS A METHOD THAT ALLOWS FOR THE UNIT TO RECEIVE OFFENDER INFORMATION ELECTRONICALLY.  THE CURRENT PROCESS IS EXTREMELY TIME CONSUMING FOR BOTH LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AND THE SOR UNIT, SLOWED BY MULTIPLE STEPS, INCLUDING TRANSPORTATION AND MAILING OF PAPERWORK, EMAILING TO CLARIFY THE DATA, AND REQUESTS FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION.  

 

THE SOR UNIT IS EXPECTED TO PROCESS ALL NEW OFFENDER INFORMATION WITHIN A DEADLINE OF THREE DAYS, AS REQUIRED BY FBI’S ADAM WALSH ACT.  THE CURRENT PROCESS HINDERS MAINTAINING TIMELY AND CONSISTENT INPUT OF INFORMATION.  THE DEVELOPMENT OF A WEB PORTAL CONNECTED TO THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY DATABASE WILL ALLOW FOR LOCAL JURISDICTIONS TO ACCESS AND UTILIZE WHEN AN OFFENDER ARRIVES AT THE POLICE DEPARTMENT FOR REGISTRATION WITH INFORMATION CAPTURED ELECTRONICALLY, AND IMMEDIATELY SUBMITTED TO THE UNIT FOR APPROVAL.  THIS WILL ALLOW THE REGISTRY TO RECEIVE AND UPDATE ALL THE INFORMATION TO THE PUBLIC WEBSITE WITHIN THE ALLOTTED FEDERAL TIMEFRAME AS REQUIRED BY LAW.

 

IN ORDER TO ACCOMPLISH THIS PROJECT, THE SOR COMMANDER WILL BE WORKING DIRECTLY WITH ALL MEMBERS OF THE TEST GROUP; MADE UP OF LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS ON A WEEKLY BASIS OR AS NEEDED.  THIS WORKING GROUP CAN REMAIN FLEXIBLE AND ADD ADDITIONAL LOCAL LEVEL MEMBERS AS NEEDED.  THE OBJECTIVES WILL INCLUDE MAKING SURE THE GOALS OF THE NEW DATABASE ARE MET, AND THAT THE “REAL TIME” SECURE DATA TRANSFERS ARE EFFECTIVE FOR ALL JURISDICTIONS.

 

THE NEW HAMPSHIRE SORNA WORKING GROUP, COMPRISED OF MANY STAKEHOLDERS, WILL ALLOW THESE AGENCIES A FEELING OF OWNERSHIP IN REGARDS TO THE SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS FOR EACH OFFENDER THEY ARE RESPONSIBLE TO INPUT.  ADDITIONALLY, SERGEANT RICHARD PERREAULT OF NH SOR UNIT AND THE U.S. MARSHAL’S OFFICE WILL CONTINUE TO WORK TOGETHER ON IDENTIFYING AND TRACKING NON-COMPLIANT OFFENDERS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE AND THE UNITED STATES.  

 

NEW HAMPSHIRE STATE POLICE TROOPERS WILL CONTINUE TO BE ASSIGNED OVERTIME IN ORDER TO REVIEW NON-COMPLAINT OFFENDERS AND TO CONFIRM INFORMATION RECEIVED FROM THE LOCAL JURISDICTIONS IN ORDER TO ASSIST WITH PROPER SET UP AND MAINTENANCE OF THE NEW DATABASE.  THEY WILL BE WORKING IN THE FIELD INDEPENDENTLY WHILE MAINTAIN A WORKING RELATIONSHIP WITH LOCAL JURISDICTIONS.  

 

THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF UTILIZING THIS FUNDING IS TO BRING NEW HAMPSHIRE INTO FULL COMPLIANCE WITH SORNA REQUIREMENTS.

THE NORTH DAKOTA BUREAU OF CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION (BCI), THROUGH THE NORTH DAKOTA OFFICE OF ATTORNEY GENERAL (NDOAG), WOULD LIKE TO REQUEST $25,371 IN SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA) FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE ADAM WALSH ACT. THIS IS IN RESPONSE TO THE INVITATION TO APPLY. 

 

BCI PLANS TO FURTHER ENHANCE THE FUNCTIONALITY AND FORMATTING OF THE EXISTING NORTH DAKOTA SEX OFFENDER WEBSITE. THESE CHANGES WILL BETTER SERVE THE CITIZENS OF NORTH DAKOTA BY ADDING THE ABILITY TO SEAMLESSLY TRACK EACH OFFENDER AND ADD OTHER VARIOUS FUNCTIONS AND DETAILS TO GAIN SORNA COMPLIANCE IN THIS SECTION.  TO ACCOMPLISH THESE THINGS, ADDITIONAL CHANGES ARE NECESSARY TO THE EXISTING SYSTEM.  

 

EACH ASPECT OF THIS SORNA FY 2022 GRANT APPLICATION SUPPORTS ND’S OVERARCHING STRATEGY OF MOVING CLOSER TO SORNA COMPLIANCE. GRANTING THIS REQUEST FOR SORNA FY 2022 FUNDS WILL ALLOW THE NDOAG’S PROJECT TEAM, WHICH CONSISTS OF TECHNICAL, LEGAL, AND PROGRAMMATIC STAFF, TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY TO COMPLETE THE OBJECTIVES OUTLINED ABOVE.

THE EDWARD BYRNE MEMORIAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE GRANT (JAG) PROGRAM ALLOWS STATES TO SUPPORT A BROAD RANGE OF ACTIVITIES TO PREVENT AND CONTROL CRIME BASED ON THEIR OWN STATE AND LOCAL NEEDS AND CONDITIONS. GRANT FUNDS CAN BE USED FOR STATE AND LOCAL INITIATIVES, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAINING, PERSONNEL, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, CONTRACTUAL SUPPORT, AND INFORMATION SYSTEMS FOR CRIMINAL JUSTICE OR CIVIL PROCEEDINGS, INCLUDING FOR ANY ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING PROGRAM AREAS: 1) LAW ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS; 2) PROSECUTION AND COURT PROGRAMS; 3) PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS; 4) CORRECTIONS AND COMMUNITY CORRECTIONS PROGRAMS; 5) DRUG TREATMENT AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS; 6) PLANNING, EVALUATION, AND TECHNOLOGY IMPROVEMENT PROGRAMS; 7) CRIME VICTIM AND WITNESS PROGRAMS (OTHER THAN COMPENSATION); 8) MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS AND RELATED LAW ENFORCEMENT AND CORRECTIONS PROGRAMS, INCLUDING BEHAVIORAL PROGRAMS AND CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAMS; AND 9) IMPLEMENTATION OF STATE CRISIS INTERVENTION COURT PROCEEDINGS AND RELATED PROGRAMS OR INITIATIVES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: MENTAL HEALTH COURTS; DRUG COURTS; VETERANS COURTS; AND EXTREME RISK PROTECTION ORDER PROGRAMS.

THE MONTANA BOARD OF CRIME CONTROL (MBCC) REQUESTS 2022 SORNA REALLOCATION FUNDS TO MOVE MONTANA FURTHER TOWARD SUBSTANTIAL IMPLEMENTATION OF SORNA.  

 

SINCE 2006, MONTANA HAS BEEN WORKING TOWARD SUBSTANTIAL IMPLEMENTATION, WITH CONSIDERABLE PROGRESS.  SEVERAL AREAS REMAIN NOT FULLY IMPLEMENTED.  ONE AREA IS CATEGORY ID IV, THE COMPLIANCE AREA OF REQUIRED REGISTRATION INFORMATION, THE REQUIRED CAPTURE, AND SUBMISSION OF THE OFFENDERS’ PALM PRINTS.  THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE ISSUE OF PALM PRINT SUBMISSION AND TIMELINESS OF INFORMATION PROCESSING FOR OFFENDER REGISTRATIONS.

 

THIS PROJECT CONTINUES MTDOJ’S EFFORT TO DEPLOY 4 PALM-CAPABLE LIVESCANS.  MTDOJ REQUESTS FUNDS TO OBTAIN AND DEPLOY PALM CAPABLE LIVESCANS AT FOUR CRIMINAL JUSTICE ENTITIES RESPONSIBLE FOR SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION. THE LIVESCANS WILL ENABLE REGISTERING AGENCIES TO CAPTURE NOT ONLY FINGERPRINTS, BUT ALSO PALM PRINTS.  THE LIVESCAN SYSTEMS WILL BE DEPLOYED IN SECURE ADMINISTRATIVE LOCATIONS OUTSIDE OF DETENTION CENTER BOOKING AREAS.  THE LIVESCANS WILL BE NETWORKED TO THE MTDOJ AUTOMATED BIOMETRIC IDENTIFICATION SYSTEM (ABIS) SO THAT THE FINGERPRINT/PALM PRINT TRANSACTIONS CAN BE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY TO INITIATE THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION.  THE MTDOJ ABIS IS ALREADY CAPABLE OF RECEIVING AND PROCESSING PALM PRINTS, SO NO ADDITIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE OR PROGRAMMING IS NECESSARY FOR PALM PRINT PROCESSING.  ALONG WITH THE DEPLOYMENT OF THE NEW LIVESCANS, EXPERIENCED MTDOJ BUSINESS AND IT PERSONNEL WILL PROVIDE OPERATOR TRAINING FOR USE OF THE SYSTEMS, AND COMPLIANCE TRAINING REGARDING STATUTORY AND TIMELINESS REQUIREMENTS FOR SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION, COMPLETING THIS PROJECT EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY.  

 

IN MARCH 2020 MTDOJ COMPLETED AND DEPLOYED A CRIMINAL HISTORY PORTAL UPDATE AS PART OF A NCHIP 2016 PROJECT.  PART OF THAT PROJECT WAS A NEW MONTANA STATE REGISTRY (MSR) CENTRAL REPOSITORY FOR TRACKING ALL MONTANA SEX OFFENDER RECORDS; MONITORING, REGISTERING, AND TRACKING SEX OFFENDERS. PRELIMINARY RECORDS ARE INITIATED UPON THE ENTRY OF DISPOSITION DATA WITHIN THE MONTANA CRIMINAL HISTORY, NOTIFICATION FROM THE SORNA PORTAL OF AN OFFENDER RELOCATING TO MONTANA OR MANUALLY BY AN MSR USER. LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL PARTNERS WILL HAVE DIRECT ACCESS TO THE MSR. LOCAL AGENCIES WILL HAVE THEIR OWN WORK QUEUE TO ASSIST THEM IN MANAGING THE SEX OFFENDERS WITHIN THEIR JURISDICTION. THE MSR WAS DESIGNED TO STREAMLINE THE MANAGEMENT OF MONTANA’S SEX OFFENDERS. IT IS EXPECTED THAT THE REDUCTION OF REDUNDANCIES AND INCREASED EFFICIENCIES WILL IMPROVE THE TIMELINESS, ACCURACY, AND COMPLETENESS OF MONTANA’S SEX OFFENDERS’ RECORDS IN NCIC.   

 

MONTANA’S CRIMINAL JUSTICE PARTNERS HAVE A STRONG HISTORY OF COOPERATION FOR WORKING TOWARD SUBSTANTIAL IMPLEMENTATION OF SORNA REQUIREMENTS.

THE EDWARD BYRNE MEMORIAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE GRANT (JAG) PROGRAM ALLOWS STATES TO SUPPORT A BROAD RANGE OF ACTIVITIES TO PREVENT AND CONTROL CRIME BASED ON THEIR OWN STATE AND LOCAL NEEDS AND CONDITIONS. GRANT FUNDS CAN BE USED FOR STATE AND LOCAL INITIATIVES, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAINING, PERSONNEL, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, CONTRACTUAL SUPPORT, AND INFORMATION SYSTEMS FOR CRIMINAL JUSTICE OR CIVIL PROCEEDINGS, INCLUDING FOR ANY ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING PROGRAM AREAS: 1) LAW ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS; 2) PROSECUTION AND COURT PROGRAMS; 3) PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS; 4) CORRECTIONS AND COMMUNITY CORRECTIONS PROGRAMS; 5) DRUG TREATMENT AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS; 6) PLANNING, EVALUATION, AND TECHNOLOGY IMPROVEMENT PROGRAMS; 7) CRIME VICTIM AND WITNESS PROGRAMS (OTHER THAN COMPENSATION); 8) MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS AND RELATED LAW ENFORCEMENT AND CORRECTIONS PROGRAMS, INCLUDING BEHAVIORAL PROGRAMS AND CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAMS; AND 9) IMPLEMENTATION OF STATE CRISIS INTERVENTION COURT PROCEEDINGS AND RELATED PROGRAMS OR INITIATIVES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: MENTAL HEALTH COURTS; DRUG COURTS; VETERANS COURTS; AND EXTREME RISK PROTECTION ORDER PROGRAMS.

THE BUREAU OF CRIMINAL APPREHENSION (BCA) IS THE CENTRAL REPOSITORY FOR ALL PREDATORY OFFENDER INFORMATION IN THE STATE OF MINNESOTA.  THE REGISTRY WAS CREATED IN 1991 AFTER THE ABDUCTION AND DISAPPEARANCE OF JACOB WETTERLING.  MINNESOTA CURRENTLY HAS OVER 18,000 REGISTERED OFFENDERS.

IN NOVEMBER 2015, THE BCA SUBMITTED A SORNA IMPLEMENTATION PACKAGE TO THE SMART OFFICE FOR REVIEW. IN SEPTEMBER 2016, THE BCA RECEIVED THE RESULTS OF THE REVIEW FROM THE SMART OFFICE. ALTHOUGH THE BCA WAS DEEMED TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH SEVERAL OF THE SORNA REQUIREMENTS, THE SUMMARY REPORT INDICATED THAT THE BCA HAD NOT SUBSTANTIALLY IMPLEMENTED SORNA.

THE BCA IS PROPOSING TO UTILIZE THE SORNA REALLOCATION GRANT FUNDING CONTINUE TO ADDRESS DEFICIENCIES IDENTIFIED IN THE REQUIREMENT OUTLINED IN THE SORNA IMPLEMENTATION PACKAGE REVIEW.  MINNESOTA DID NOT MEET SORNA REQUIREMENT X – PUBLIC REGISTRY WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS ­­­– LIMITED OFFENDERS POSTED WITH NOT ALL REQUIRED DATA POSTED.  

THE BCA HAS ALREADY DEVELOPED A NEW PUBLIC REGISTRANT WEBSITE FOR DISPLAYING NONCOMPLIANT OFFENDER AS PERMITTED BY MINNESOTA LAW.  FUNDING CONSTRAINTS LIMITED DEVELOPMENT ON THAT SITE AND MAPPING CAPABILITIES HAVE NOT BEEN ADDED.  THE BCA WILL USE THE MONEY PROVIDED BY THIS GRANT TO COMPLETE THE WORK ON MAPPING CAPABILITIES, THE ADDITION OF WHICH WILL BRING THE MN NONCOMPLIANT PUBLIC WEBSITE AS CLOSE TO SUBSTANTIAL COMPLIANCE WITH SORNA REQUIREMENT X AS ALLOWABLE WITHIN STATE LAW.

THE EXECUTIVE OFFICE OF PUBLIC SAFETY AND SECURITY (EOPSS) IS THE LEAD AGENCY ON THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS’ EFFORT TO SUBSTANTIALLY COMPLY WITH AND IMPLEMENT THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA) AND PROVIDES ADMINISTRATIVE AND MANAGERIAL OVERSIGHT TO THE COMMONWEALTH’S SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY BOARD (SORB).  IN AN EFFORT TO CONTINUE TO MOVE THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS TOWARDS SUBSTANTIAL IMPLEMENTATION OF SORNA, EOPSS PROPOSES TO UTILIZE FISCAL YEAR (FY) 2022 SORNA REALLOCATION FUNDS FOR CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT OF A SORNA COMPLIANCE COORDINATOR, AND THE CONTINUATION OF THE ADDRESS VERIFICATION PROGRAM.

CURRENTLY, THE STATE OF ARIZONA IS NOT SUBSTANTIALLY SORNA COMPLIANT.  THE ARIZONA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY (AZDPS) IS ACTIVELY WORKING TO ENSURE COMPLETE AND ACCURATE INFORMATION IS RECORDED AND UPDATED AS REQUIRED.  THESE STEPS WILL BRING THE STATE CLOSER TO SUBSTANTIAL IMPLEMENTATION OF SORNA, WHILE AZDPS WORKS TOWARD MAKING THE NEEDED STATUTORY CHANGES. AZDPS IS REQUESTING TO USE GRANT FUNDING TO ENSURE THE ACCURATE AND COMPLETE SUBMISSION OF RECORDS TO THE NATIONAL CRIME INFORMATION CENTER (NCIC) BY PACKING THE RECORD. THIS WILL REQUIRE ADDITIONAL STAFF HOURS TO REVIEW AND COMPLETE. 

WITH THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (SORMS) UPGRADE THE DEPARTMENT IS UNDERGOING, AND SUBSEQUENT TRANSFER OF DATA ENTRY DUTIES TO THE SHERIFF’S OFFICES, AZDPS NEEDS TO ENSURE THE EXISTING INFORMATION IS AUDITED AND UPDATED AS REQUIRED.

INTERMITTENT EMPLOYEES AND FULL-TIME EMPLOYEES WILL WORK APPROXIMATELY 2,500 HOURS TO COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING: 

1. THE STATE OF ARIZONA MAINTAINS OVER 15,000 ACTIVE SEX OFFENDER FILES.  AZDPS IS CONDUCTING AN AUDIT OF THE OFFENDERS' CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORDED IN THE SORMS AND NCIC. THIS WILL ENTAIL RESEARCHING THE CRIMINAL HISTORY, ORDERING COURT DOCUMENTS, AND UPDATING THE SYSTEMS AS NEEDED. 

2. DPS CONDUCTS OVER 11,000 SEX OFFENDER ENTRIES INTO THE ARIZONA CRIMINAL JUSTICE INFORMATION SYSTEM (ACJIS) ANNUALLY.  ARIZONA AVERAGES OVER 1,000 NEW OFFENDERS AND OVER 10,000 UPDATED REGISTRATIONS ANNUALLY.  THE INTERMITTENT STAFF WILL CONDUCT QUALITY ASSURANCE TO ENSURE ACCURACY IN THE TRANSMISSION OF DATA TO NCIC.

THE ARKANSAS DEPARTMENT OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION, OFFICE OF INTERGOVERNMENTAL SERVICES WILL UTILIZE THE FISCAL YEAR 2022, SORNA REALLOCATION FUNDS TOWARDS SORNA COMPLIANCE, MAINTAINING CURRENT SORNA REQUIREMENTS, AND RECONSTRUCTING/BUILDING THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY THROUGH A SUB AWARD ISSUED TO THE ARKANSAS PUBLIC SAFETY DEPARTMENT/DIVISION OF CRIME INFORMATION CENTER FOR PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION.

THE DEPARTMENT OF FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION, OFFICE OF INTERGOVERNMENTAL SERVICES WILL ADMINISTER JAG/SORNA FUNDING FOR THIS GRANT AND WILL PASS THROUGH THE FUNDING ON A DISBURSEMENT/REIMBURSEMENT BASIS TO ARKANSAS PUBLIC SAFETY DEPARTMENT/DIVISION CRIME INFORMATION CENTER, WHO HAS BEEN CHARGED WITH PERFORMING THE TASKS THAT WOULD DRAW ARKANSAS CLOSER AND/OR FINALIZE “SUBSTANTIAL COMPLIANCE” WITH THE REQUIREMENTS OF SORNA AND ADDRESS THE ADAM WALSH ACT. FISCAL YEAR 2022 REALLOCATION FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED TO CONTINUE AND SUPPORT THE REBUILDING, REDESIGNING AND RECONSTRUCTING OF A NEW MANAGEMENT SYSTEM FOR THE OPERATION OF THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY SYSTEM. THE NEW SYSTEM, CENSOR 2, WILL NOT ONLY ADDRESS AND RESOLVE ISSUES PERTAINING TO DATA COLLECTION, TRACKING, AND RETRIEVAL OF DATA/COMMUNICATIONS AS WELL AS REPORTING TO NCIC, BUT IT WILL ALSO PROVIDE FOR ELECTRONIC NOTIFICATIONS OF OFFENDER ISSUES TO LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES. THE IN-HOUSE CUSTOMIZED SYSTEM, CENSOR 2, WILL BE MORE FEASIBLE, USER FRIENDLY, AND MORE EFFICIENT AS IT RELATES TO MAPPING CAPABILITIES, UPDATING OF INFORMATION NATIONALLY, AND TRANSFERRING OF FILES. THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE NEW SYSTEM WILL TAKE MULTIPLE YEARS TO FINALIZE AND COMPLETE. THE SORNA REALLOCATION FUNDING HAS BEEN DESIGNATED TO SUPPORT THE FINANCING OF THE NEW SYSTEM.

THE WEST VIRGINIA DIVISION OF ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES (DAS)/JUSTICE AND COMMUNITY SERVICES (JCS) WILL ADMINISTER FUNDS FROM THE ALLOCATION OF THE FY 2022 SEX OFFENDER AND REGISTRATION NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA) GRANT PROGRAM. FUNDS WILL BE SUB-GRANTED TO THE WEST VIRGINIA STATE POLICE, WHICH WILL USE THIS AWARD TO ENHANCE PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO IMPLEMENT THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA) PORTION OF THE ADAM WALSH ACT (42 U.S.C. § 16901, ET SEQ.). THE ADAM WALSH ACT (AWA) IS DESIGNED TO PROTECT CHILDREN AND ADULTS FROM SEXUAL EXPLOITATION AND VIOLENT CRIME, PREVENT CHILD ABUSE AND CHILD PORNOGRAPHY, PROMOTE INTERNET SAFETY, AND HONOR THE MEMORY OF ADAM WALSH AND OTHER CRIME VICTIMS. SORNA WAS ENACTED TO PROTECT THE PUBLIC FROM CONVICTED SEX OFFENDERS BY ESTABLISHING A COMPREHENSIVE NATIONAL SYSTEM FOR THE REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION OF THOSE OFFENDERS.

SORNA FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR DEVELOPING AND/OR ENHANCING SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION PROGRAMS THAT SUPPORT SUBSTANTIAL IMPLEMENTATION OF TITLE 1 OF THE AWA, KNOWN AS THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA).

THE STATE OF INDIANA HAS BEEN WORKING TOWARDS SORNA COMPLIANCE SINCE 2006.  TO DATE, COMPLIANCE HAS NOT BEEN ACHIEVED ALTHOUGH INDIANA HAS ADDRESSED PORTIONS OF TITLE I OVER THE LAST SEVERAL YEARS. IN MID-2016, THE STATE RECEIVED ITS SORNA SUBSTANTIAL IMPLEMENTATION REVIEW REPORT FROM THE SMART OFFICE. THE REPORT, RESPONDING TO COMPLIANCE MATERIALS SUBMITTED THE PREVIOUS FALL, OUTLINED AREAS WHERE THE STATE NEEDED ADDITIONAL WORK. EFFORTS TO ADDRESS THESE ISSUES CONTINUE TO MOVE FORWARD WITH THE AWARDING OF PREVIOUS SUPPORT FOR ADAM WALSH ACT IMPLEMENTATION GRANT PROGRAM AWARDS AND SORNA REALLOCATION FUNDING, THOUGH ADDITIONAL PROGRESS IS NEEDED.  THIS APPLICATION ATTEMPTS TO MOVE INDIANA FURTHER TOWARDS COMPLIANCE.  

FOR THIS REQUEST, INDIANA HAS DECIDED TO BUILD UPON PREVIOUS SORNA REALLOCATION SUBMISSIONS. THE AREAS BEING ADDRESSED ARE HIGHLIGHTED BELOW BUT SPECIFICALLY DEAL WITH WEAKNESSES FOUND IN SECTION IV AND X OF THE SORNA COMPLIANCE CHECKLIST AND IMPLEMENTATION REPORT. THE STATE OF INDIANA, THROUGH THE INDIANA CRIMINAL JUSTICE INSTITUTE, WITH THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION (IDOC OR DEPARTMENT) AS THE LEAD IMPLEMENTING AGENCY, IS MAKING APPLICATION IN THE AMOUNT OF $169.989.00 AND A GRANT PERIOD OF TWENTY-FOUR (24) MONTHS

IF INDIANA IS SUCCESSFUL IN SECURING THESE FUNDS, THE STATE WILL USE ESTABLISHED PROCUREMENT PROCEDURES TO SECURE STAFFING TO CONTINUE CRIMINAL HISTORY IMPROVEMENT EFFORTS ORIGINALLY STARTED UNDER FY 16 SORNA REALLOCATION FUNDING. EFFORTS INCLUDE DEFINING POSITION REQUIREMENTS, ADVERTISING POSITIONS, PROCURING STAFF, REVIEWING AND SELECTING CANDIDATES, AND WORKING ON IMPROVING CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORDS.

IN ILLINOIS, THE ILLINOIS STATE POLICE (ISP) SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION UNIT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE RECEIPT, STORAGE, AND APPROPRIATE DISSEMINATION OF ALL SEX OFFENDER RECORDS.  SINCE THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT WAS SIGNED IN JULY 2006, ILLINOIS HAS TAKEN MAJOR STEPS TO COME INTO COMPLIANCE. DESPITE THESE ACCOMPLISHMENTS, MUCH WORK REMAINS TO BE DONE. IN JULY 2011, ILLINOIS SUBMITTED A SUBSTANTIAL IMPLEMENTATION PACKAGE TO THE OFFICE OF SEX OFFENDER SENTENCING, MONITORING, APPREHENDING, REGISTERING, AND TRACKING (SMART OFFICE) FOR REVIEW. THE SMART OFFICE PROVIDED A REPORT TO ILLINOIS OUTLINING AREAS IN WHICH ILLINOIS WAS NOT IN COMPLIANCE WITH SORNA. AMONG THE ONE OF THE AREAS IN NEED OF IMPROVEMENT WAS ISP’S POSTING OF REGISTRANT INFORMATION ON THE PUBLIC WEBSITE AND AN E-MAIL NOTIFICATION SYSTEM FOR THE GENERAL PUBLIC. 

SORNA FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR 2022 (FFY22) FUNDS WILL BE TOWARDS THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE NEW RECORD MANAGEMENT SYSTEM FOR THE ILLINOIS STATE POLICE. THE ILLINOIS STATE POLICE RECENTLY INITIATED LEADS 3.0 STATEWIDE. IT HAS BEEN DETERMINED THROUGH THIS PROCESS, THAT THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE RECORD MANAGEMENT SYSTEM FOR OFFENDER REGISTRATION WILL BE A TIME-CONSUMING PROCESS THAT WILL NEED TO BE CREATED TO SYNCHRONIZE EFFORTLESSLY WITH LEADS 3.0. THIS WILL INVOLVE A DETAILED DEVELOPMENT ACTION PLAN TO INCLUDE ALL THE NECESSARY ITEMS DUE TO THE COMPLICATED ILLINOIS REGISTRATION STATUTES.

PROJECT TITLE: IMPROVING TRANSFER OF REGISTRATION PHOTOS TO THE IDAHO CENTRAL REPOSITORY

 

PROJECT PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES: PROVIDE AID TO THE CENTRAL STATE REPOSITORY (IDAHO STATE POLICE (ISP)/BUREAU OF CRIMINAL IDENTIFICATION (BCI)) IN PROCESSING UNIT BACKLOG AND INCREASE COMPLIANCE WITH FBI REQUIRED TIMELINES THROUGH HIRING TWO (2) PART-TIME TEMPORARY TECHNICAL RECORDS SPECIALIST 1 (TRS1) POSITIONS TO TAKE UP SOME OF THE DAILY PROCESSING TO GIVE FULL-TIME SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION (SOR) UNIT STAFF TIME TO TACKLE SUBSTANTIALLY EQUIVALENT DETERMINATION WRITE-UPS AND ENSURE THAT FEDERAL PROCESSING TIMELINES ARE MET. THIS APPLICATION ALSO SEEKS TO FUND TRAVEL FOR UNIT STAFF TO DELIVER CAMERAS AND ACCESSORIES TO THE 44 COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICES (CSO) IN ADVANCE OF AN ELECTRONIC INTERFACE THAT WILL TRANSFER OFFENDER REGISTRATION PHOTOGRAPHS TO THE STATE WITHOUT HAVING TO GO THROUGH THE IDAHO TRANSPORTATION DEPARTMENT (ITD) AS IT IS NOW CONFIGURED.


	ELIMINATE THE 600+ LEGACY RECORDS BACKLOG 
	INCREASE TIMELY NEW REGISTRATION PROCESSING BY 14% OR MORE.
	INCREASE TIMELY REGISTRATION AND ADDRESS VERIFICATIONS PROCESSING BY AT LEAST 6%.
	DISTRIBUTE CAMERAS AND ACCESSORIES TO THE 44 COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE REGISTRATION AGENCIES AND PROVIDE TRAINING ON THEIR USE.


STRATEGIES: THIS PROJECT WILL AID THE SOR UNIT STAFF; TO TAKE SOME OF THE DATA ENTRY WORKLOAD OFF THE FULL-TIME STAFF WHO CAN THEN FOCUS ON BACKLOGGED SUBSTANTIALLY EQUIVALENT DETERMINATIONS.  THE PART-TIME STAFF WILL BE ABLE TO WORK ON BACKLOGGED TASKS MATCHING LEGACY RECORDS TO OFFENDER FILES THAT WERE NOT COMPLETED DURING THE MOST RECENT UPGRADE TO THE REGISTRY SOFTWARE.  THE PART-TIME STAFF WILL ALLOW THE UNIT TO REGAIN COMPLIANCE WITH FBI TIMELINES FOR REGISTRATION PROCESSING.  FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO FACILITATE STAFF TRAVEL TO DISTRIBUTE CAMERAS AND ACCESSORIES TO EACH COUNTY’S REGISTRATION SITE.  EQUIPMENT HAS BEEN PURCHASED BUT THE ELECTRONIC INTERFACE HAS BEEN PUT ON HOLD DUE TO STATE SWITCH REPLACEMENT ISSUES.  WHILE THE ELECTRONIC INTERFACE IS NOT READY FOR USE YET, WE HAVE A WORK-AROUND PROCESS FOR THE AGENCIES TO BEGIN SUBMITTING OFFENDER REGISTRATION PHOTOS DIRECTLY TO THE STATE REGISTRY WITHOUT HAVING TO USE OTHER AGENCY’S EQUIPMENT OR HAVING ITD PARTICIPATE AS A MIDDLEMAN IN THE TRANSFER PROCESS.  HOWEVER, THE MOST IMPORTANT FACTOR FOR THE TRAVEL IS, ITD WILL BE DISCONTINUING THE TRANSFER PROCESS AT THE END OF 2022 MAKING IT IMPERATIVE THAT ISP/BCI DISTRIBUTE THE CAMERAS AND PROVIDE AN ALTERNATIVE PROCESS FOR THE COUNTIES.

THE EDWARD BYRNE MEMORIAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE GRANT (JAG) PROGRAM ALLOWS STATES TO SUPPORT A BROAD RANGE OF ACTIVITIES TO PREVENT AND CONTROL CRIME BASED ON THEIR OWN STATE AND LOCAL NEEDS AND CONDITIONS. GRANT FUNDS CAN BE USED FOR STATE AND LOCAL INITIATIVES, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAINING, PERSONNEL, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, CONTRACTUAL SUPPORT, AND INFORMATION SYSTEMS FOR CRIMINAL JUSTICE OR CIVIL PROCEEDINGS, INCLUDING FOR ANY ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING PROGRAM AREAS: 1) LAW ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS; 2) PROSECUTION AND COURT PROGRAMS; 3) PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS; 4) CORRECTIONS AND COMMUNITY CORRECTIONS PROGRAMS; 5) DRUG TREATMENT AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS; 6) PLANNING, EVALUATION, AND TECHNOLOGY IMPROVEMENT PROGRAMS; 7) CRIME VICTIM AND WITNESS PROGRAMS (OTHER THAN COMPENSATION); 8) MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS AND RELATED LAW ENFORCEMENT AND CORRECTIONS PROGRAMS, INCLUDING BEHAVIORAL PROGRAMS AND CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAMS; AND 9) IMPLEMENTATION OF STATE CRISIS INTERVENTION COURT PROCEEDINGS AND RELATED PROGRAMS OR INITIATIVES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: MENTAL HEALTH COURTS; DRUG COURTS; VETERANS COURTS; AND EXTREME RISK PROTECTION ORDER PROGRAMS.

THE IOWA DIVISION OF CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION (DCI) IS A SUBSET ORGANIZATION OF THE DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY. SINCE 1995, THE DCI HAS BEEN STATUTORILY REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN THE INFORMATION THAT IS POSTED TO THE IOWA SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY. THE DCI HAS BEEN BUILDING ON THE PROJECT SINCE THAT TIME BY ASSEMBLING A CENTRAL DATABASE, ADDING INFRASTRUCTURE, HIRING KEY VALIDATION STAFF AND FORMING A SWORN UNIT OF SPECIAL AGENTS TO WORK EXCLUSIVELY ON SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY COMPLIANCE CASES. TODAY, THE SOR SENDS OUT APPROXIMATELY 58,000 PUBLIC EMAIL NOTIFICATIONS PER MONTH ON THE CHANGES IN OFFENDER’S STATUS OR RELEVANT INFORMATION. IN ADDITION, THE PUBLIC WEBSITE RECEIVES ABOUT 1,100,000 PAGE VIEWS PER MONTH. THE IOWA SOR OFFICE PROVIDES MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC DETAILED INFORMATION ABOUT REGISTERED SEX OFFENDERS, CONDUCTS INVESTIGATIONS CONCERNING VIOLATIONS OF THE REGISTRY LAW AND WORKS WITH THE UNITES STATES MARSHALS SERVICE ON A ROUTINE BASIS. THROUGH THE REQUESTS IN THIS PROPOSAL INFORMATION WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE PUBLIC AS WELL AS CRIMINAL JUSTICE AGENCIES IN A MORE TIMELY AND ACCURATE MANNER.

THE FUNDING AVAILABLE THROUGH THE SORNA REALLOCATION FUNDS GRANT IS IMPORTANT TO NOT ONLY MOVE THE STATE OF IOWA TOWARDS COMPLIANCE WITH THE FEDERAL ADAM WALSH CHILD PROTECTION AND SAFETY ACT BUT ALSO TO MAINTAIN THE GREAT STRIDES THE STATE HAS MADE IN THE PROGRAM IN THE PAST 24 YEARS.

PREVIOUS SORNA AWARDS WERE USED TO UPDATE THE IOWA SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY DATABASE (ISORD).  THE 2022 SORNA AWARD WILL BE USED TO MAKE REVISIONS/ENHANCEMENTS TO THE SOR SYSTEM.  FUNDING WILL ALSO SUPPORT TRAINING OF DCI STAFF AND LOCAL PARTNERS.

THE HAWAII CRIMINAL JUSTICE DATA CENTER (HCJDC) MANAGES THE STATEWIDE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION PROGRAM AND IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION RECORDS AND INFORMATION, NOTIFYING LAW ENFORCEMENT OF NON-COMPLIANT AND ABSCONDED SEX OFFENDERS, AND NOTIFYING OTHER JURISDICTIONS OF SEX OFFENDERS RELOCATING TO THEIR JURISDICTION.

SORNA REQUIRES OFFENDERS CONVICTED OF A QUALIFIED SEX OFFENSE TO REGISTER AND BE CLASSIFIED INTO ONE OF THREE TIERS. HAWAII’S LAW REQUIRES COVERED OFFENDERS, WHETHER A RESIDENT OF THIS STATE OR NOT, WHO REMAINS IN THIS STATE FOR MORE THAN TEN DAYS OR FOR AN AGGREGATE PERIOD EXCEEDING THIRTY DAYS IN ONE CALENDAR YEAR TO REGISTER AS A SEX OFFENDER. OFFENDERS ARE ALSO REQUIRED TO VERIFY AND UPDATE INFORMATION EVERY YEAR, IN ADDITION TO SIGNING PERIODIC VERIFICATION FORMS QUARTERLY BY EITHER MAILING BACK THE DOCUMENTS WITHIN TEN DAYS UPON RECEIPT OR REPORTING IN PERSON TO A REGISTERING AGENCY.

THE PROJECT GOALS AND OBJECTIVES ARE TO ENSURE THE HCJDC COMPLIES WITH SORNA REQUIREMENTS BY CLASSIFYING OFFENDERS WITH OUT-OF-STATE SEX OFFENSES INTO SORNA COMPLIANT TIERS AND DETERMINING WHETHER THE OFFENDER IS REQUIRED TO REGISTER AS A SEX OFFENDER PURSUANT TO 846E, HRS. THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE DIVISION, DEPUTY ATTORNEY’S GENERAL, ASSISTS THE HCJDC WITH THE CLASSIFICATION PROCESS AND DETERMINATION. IN ADDITION, THE HCJDC PARTNERS WITH THE INVESTIGATIONS DIVISION TO ENFORCE REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS. THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS ARE AN ARCHIPELAGO CONSISTING OF EIGHT MAJOR ISLANDS SEPARATED BY THE PACIFIC OCEAN. AS A RESULT, TRAVEL BETWEEN ISLANDS IS PRIMARILY DONE BY AIRPLANE. THE INVESTIGATIONS DIVISION AND ITS PERSONNEL ARE BASED ON THE ISLAND OF OAHU. THE DIVISION CURRENTLY LACKS SUFFICIENT RESOURCES TO REGULARLY FLY PERSONNEL OUT TO CONDUCT COMPLIANCE CHECKS ON OFFENDERS RESIDING ON THE NEIGHBOR ISLANDS. THE INVESTIGATORS ASSIST WITH THE IN-PERSON COMPLIANCE CHECKS AT THE LAST KNOWN REGISTERED ADDRESS OF EVERY REGISTERED OFFENDER WHO FAILS TO COMPLY WITH HAWAII’S VERIFICATION REQUIREMENT.  WHEN THE INVESTIGATIONS DIVISION CONFIRMS THAT A REGISTERED SEX OFFENDER HAS FAILED TO COMPLY WITH THE STATE’S VERIFICATION REQUIREMENTS, CRIMINAL INVESTIGATIONS WILL BE CONFERRED FOR THE PROSECUTION TO THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE DIVISION, DEPARTMENT OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL, OR COUNTY PROSECUTOR’S OFFICE.

 

IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE DEPUTY ATTORNEY’S GENERAL AND THE INVESTIGATIONS DIVISION, THE HCJDC HOPES TO ENSURE PUBLIC SAFETY BY CLASSIFYING OFFENDERS PROMPTLY AND KEEPING ALL OFFENDERS ACCOUNTABLE BY TRAVELING TO THE NEIGHBORING ISLANDS TO CONDUCT IN-PERSON COMPLIANCE AND RESIDENTIAL CHECKS AND CONFER OFFENDERS FOR THE PROSECUTION WHO FAIL TO COMPLY.

THE EDWARD BYRNE MEMORIAL JUSTICE ASSISTANCE GRANT (JAG) PROGRAM ALLOWS STATES TO SUPPORT A BROAD RANGE OF ACTIVITIES TO PREVENT AND CONTROL CRIME BASED ON THEIR OWN STATE AND LOCAL NEEDS AND CONDITIONS. GRANT FUNDS CAN BE USED FOR STATE AND LOCAL INITIATIVES, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAINING, PERSONNEL, EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, CONTRACTUAL SUPPORT, AND INFORMATION SYSTEMS FOR CRIMINAL JUSTICE OR CIVIL PROCEEDINGS, INCLUDING FOR ANY ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING PROGRAM AREAS: 1) LAW ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS; 2) PROSECUTION AND COURT PROGRAMS; 3) PREVENTION AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS; 4) CORRECTIONS AND COMMUNITY CORRECTIONS PROGRAMS; 5) DRUG TREATMENT AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS; 6) PLANNING, EVALUATION, AND TECHNOLOGY IMPROVEMENT PROGRAMS; 7) CRIME VICTIM AND WITNESS PROGRAMS (OTHER THAN COMPENSATION); 8) MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS AND RELATED LAW ENFORCEMENT AND CORRECTIONS PROGRAMS, INCLUDING BEHAVIORAL PROGRAMS AND CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAMS; AND 9) IMPLEMENTATION OF STATE CRISIS INTERVENTION COURT PROCEEDINGS AND RELATED PROGRAMS OR INITIATIVES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: MENTAL HEALTH COURTS; DRUG COURTS; VETERANS COURTS; AND EXTREME RISK PROTECTION ORDER PROGRAMS.

THE CONNECTICUT STATE POLICE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY UNIT (SORU) IS SEEKING A GRANT AWARD FOR THE PURPOSE OF MEETING OR AUGMENTING THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA) REQUIREMENTS, AND TO ASSIST THE CONNECTICUT SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY IN ITS IMPLEMENTATION OF THESE REQUIREMENTS.  

THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY ADDRESSING THE FOLLOWING THREE AREAS:

1. PROVIDE TRAINING FOR ORU PERSONNEL: THE REGISTRY CURRENTLY LACKS A DEDICATED FUNDING SOURCE FOR TRAINING.  FUNDING IS BEING REQUESTED FOR REGISTRY PERSONNEL TO ATTEND SPECIALIZED TRAINING TO INCLUDE THE ANNUAL DALLAS CRIMES AGAINST CHILDREN’S CONFERENCE (DCACC) IN DALLAS, TEXAS, THE WATCH SYSTEMS LLC REGISTERED SEX OFFENDERS CONFERENCE IN NEW ORLEANS, LA., THE SMART (SEX OFFENDER SENTENCING, MONITORING, APPREHENDING, REGISTERING AND TRACKING) OFFICE ONE DAY REGIONAL MEETING AND THE SMART OFFICE NATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON SEX OFFENDER MANAGEMENT AND ACCOUNTABILITY.

2. SUPPORT STATE PAROLE/PROBATION WITH MONTHLY COMPLIANCE CHECKS OF REGISTERED OFFENDERS.  

THE REGISTRY WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT CONNECTICUT STATE PAROLE WITH MONTHLY COMPLIANCE CHECKS WHICH ARE CONDUCTED ON AN OVERTIME BASIS BY SWORN SORU PERSONNEL. THE STATE PAROLE SPECIAL MANAGEMENT UNIT (SMU) CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY THIRTEEN (13) PAROLE OFFICERS AND ONE (1) SUPERVISOR ASSIGNED TO MANAGE SEX OFFENDER PAROLEES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT. EACH MONTHLY OPERATION IS ARRANGED BY THE SMU OFFICE AND TAKES PLACE AFTER NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS TO ENSURE A HIGH CONTACT RATE. SMU ESTABLISHES A SERIES OF TEAMS SUPPORTED BY MEMBERS OF THE SMU OFFICE, LOCAL POLICE, U.S. MARSHAL’S SERVICE, DETECTIVES FROM THE STATE POLICE COMPUTER CRIMES UNIT AND MEMBERS FROM THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY.  CONTACT IS MADE WITH OFFENDERS UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE SMU OFFICE TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE.  THE SOR UNIT WILL SUBMIT A DETAILED OPERATIONS PLAN, IF REQUIRED, PRIOR TO ANY MAJOR EVENT. PURCHASE TACTICAL CARRIER VEST, TO BE USED IN CONJUNCTION WITH COMPLIANCE CHECKS.

3.  CONDUCT QUALITY CONTROL CHECKS ON RECORDS ENTERED INTO FILENET ON A DAILY BASIS.

UNIT PERSONNEL WILL CONDUCT QUALITY CONTROL CHECKS ON ALL RECORDS ENTERED ON A DAILY BASIS. THESE CHECKS WILL ENSURE THAT DOCUMENTS ENTERED INTO FILENET (DOCUMENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM) HAVE BEEN SCANNED AND LABELED CORRECTLY. DAILY RECORDS ARE FILED BY DAY AND MONTH. UNIT PERSONNEL WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR GOING THROUGH EACH DAILY AND CHECKING A SELECT NUMBER OF DOCUMENTS TO VERIFY THAT THEY HAVE BEEN ADDED CORRECTLY. THIS PROCESS WILL HELP TO IDENTIFY ERRORS EARLY AND ALLOW FOR DOCUMENTS TO BE RESCANNED BEFORE THE HARD FILE IS SHREDDED (1 YEAR FROM DATE OF SCAN).

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO SUPPORT STATE AND FEDERAL SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION EFFORTS IN CALIFORNIA WITH THE COMPLETE IMPLEMENTATION OF A DISASTER RECOVERY (DR) PLAN AND TECHNOLOGICAL ENVIRONMENT FOR THE CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE (CA DOJ), CALIFORNIA SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY (CSOR) AND ITS SUPPORTING TECHNOLOGIES. THROUGH THIS PROPOSAL, THE CA DOJ IS SEEKING AN AWARD OF $755,177.

THE CA DOJ SEEKS GRANT FUNDING TO ACQUIRE NETWORK SPECIFIC HARDWARE OUTFITTED FOR THE DR TECHNOLOGICAL ENVIRONMENT TO FULLY IMPLEMENT THE DR PLAN SHOULD A NATURAL AND/OR TECHNOLOGICAL DISASTER ENDANGER THE CSOR TECHNOLOGIES. THE PROJECT WILL HAVE AN IMMENSE IMPACT TO THE CSOR AND ITS SUPPORTING PROGRAMS THAT EXECUTE CALIFORNIA’S SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION MANDATES AND SORNA REQUIREMENTS WHEN A DISASTER THREATENS FUNCTIONALITY OF KEY INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY (IT) INFRASTRUCTURE. WITH THE NETWORK-SPECIFIC HARDWARE, THE CA DOJ WILL SUSTAIN LONG-TERM AND EFFECTIVE INTEROPERABILITY BETWEEN THE VARIOUS CSOR APPLICATIONS AND SUPPORTING IT SYSTEMS WITHIN THE CA DOJ’S DR TECHNOLOGICAL ENVIRONMENT, AND FORTIFY THE CSOR’S IT INFRASTRUCTURE TO COMBAT THE RUTHLESS IMPACTS OF A NATURAL AND/OR TECHNOLOGICAL DISASTER. AS A RESULT, THE CA DOJ WILL ENSURE THE STAFF CAN CONTINUE TO SAFELY AND SECURELY MEET CALIFORNIA’S SEX OFFENDER REGISTRY REQUIREMENTS AND FURTHER SORNA COMPLIANCE.

THE ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY (DPS) APPLIES FOR THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION AND NOTIFICATION ACT (SORNA) REALLOCATION FUNDING FOR FEDERAL FISCAL YEAR 2022 (FFY22). REALLOCATION FUNDS PROVIDE A VITAL TOOL IN CONTINUING OUR DIGITIZATION OF THE SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION (SOR) RECORDS. THE REALLOCATION FUNDING RECEIVED FOR PRIOR YEARS AND HAS ALLOWED DPS TO MAKE STEADY PROGRESS IN SUPPORTING THE NATIONAL INITIATIVE TO MAKE RECORDS MORE READILY AVAILABLE TO OTHER JURISDICTIONS. THE DPS HAS ALSO INSTALLED DIGITAL STORAGE SYSTEMS CAPABLE OF HANDLING THE VOLUME OF SEX OFFENDER REGISTRATION RECORDS AND DEVELOPED A SOFTWARE PACKAGE TO SUPPORT QUICK, ACCURATE, AND EASILY RETRIEVABLE DIGITAL RECORDS. THE DPS PROGRAMMING STAFF ALSO DEVELOPED A DOCUMENT ARCHIVE SYSTEM TO MAINTAIN THE DIGITAL RECORDS TO STORE BOTH HISTORICAL AND ACTIVE RECORDS FOR EASY RETRIEVAL IN A CENTRALIZED LOCATION. 

 

PRIOR YEAR GRANT AND REALLOCATION FUNDING HAS ENABLED DPS TO EMPLOY A FULL TIME OFFICE ASSISTANT WORKING EXCLUSIVELY TO PREPARE, INDEX, AND DIGITIZE THE SOR RECORDS. THERE ARE CURRENTLY ABOUT 3,400 OFFENDERS ON THE ACTIVE OFFENDER REGISTRY. TO DATE, THE GRANT FUNDED OFFICE ASSISTANT POSITION HAS DIGITIZED ALL THE ACTIVE CASE FILES. DUE TO UNPRECEDENTED STAFFING TURNOVER AND RECRUITMENT CHALLENGES, THE ALASKA SOR OFFICE HAS FREQUENTLY BEEN WITHOUT DEDICATED STAFF TO PROCESS REGISTRATIONS. OTHER POSITIONS IN THE DEPARTMENT WERE TEMPORARILY REASSIGNED TO ASSIST WITH THE SOR WORKLOAD, AND THE OFFICE ASSISTANT POSITION WAS ASSIGNED TO DIGITIZE ALL INCOMING PAPER REGISTRATIONS, JUST UNDER 9,000 REGISTRATION FORMS IN FFY21.
 

WITH THE FOCUS ON ACTIVE REGISTRATIONS TO DIGITIZE DURING MUCH OF FFY21, PROGRESS ON DIGITIZING THE HISTORICAL CASE FILES WAS SLOWER THAN ANTICIPATED. THE HISTORICAL FILES ARE PRIMARILY COMPRISED OF OFFENDERS WHO COMMITTED THEIR OFFENSE PRIOR TO ALASKA'S REGISTRATION LAW; HOWEVER, THE INFORMATION IS STILL NEEDED TO ACCURATELY ASSESS DURATION SHOULD ANY OF THE OFFENDERS COMMIT A SUBSEQUENT OFFENSE OR TO PROVIDE TO OTHER STATE REGISTRIES SHOULD THE OFFENDERS RELOCATE OUT OF STATE. IT IS ESTIMATED THERE ARE 3,000 REMAINING HISTORICAL FILES TO DIGITIZE. 

 

DPS IS SEEKING ASSISTANCE TO CONTINUE FUNDING FOR THE FULL TIME OFFICE ASSISTANT POSITION TO CONTINUE THE EFFORTS TO DIGITIZE THE SOR RECORDS USING THE PENALTY FUNDS.
